Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: surfhorse
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews, my thoughts wondered if I had made a good choice, but YES I DID! The rooms were a little small, but who goes to a hotel to stay in the room? The beach was steps away. My daughter and I spent Easter weekend there and we had a blast! The people who so anything bad about this hotel should probably be the people who shouldn't travel and just stay in their own homes! I will return for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Atlantic Beach Hotel, Condado Beach, Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: surfhorse
Reviews.Content: Excellent location! Beautiful beaches! Staff was superb!!!! Enjoyed everyone at the resort including the guest. It is the happiest place on earth!!! Rooms are small with only a double bed and there is not a pool, but the ocean is a few steps away and it is fantastic! The stores around the area are rather expensive, so go to the mall if you can. I will return!!!

Reviews.Title: “An honest review”
Reviews.Author: skislopescorpion
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from February 22nd through February 28th of 2012. Before arriving I had read in some of the other reviews that the employees were rude, the rooms were tiny, the place was always under construction and about all the other "problems" that could potentially ruin our vacation but because I was trying to budget on my room so that I could finacially esperience all of Puerto Rico I opted to take a chance and roll the dice. At nearly $100.00/night you can't beat the price. Many larger hotels are within a stones throw from here but you will pay more. But it is a no frills hotel, don't expect the red carpet rolled out on arrival. Okay LOCATION ....the best!!! Beach front, walking distance to EVERYTHING, food, shopping, nightlife..you name it. It's all right there. The staff was efficient at checking us in -took maybe five minutes. They were a little stoic in apperance but I later saw that most everyone from P.R. appears this way. The rooms were small but VERY clean and well kept.. newly renovated. House keeping came by every morning to clean and provide fresh linens. The bad part is you can hear anyone walking/talking out in the halls but we were only in our rooms at night to sleep. The only construction going on was at the bar area from about 10 am until the sun went down but we could not hear it from our room. Maybe thats because we did not have an ocean facing room (why pay for this when we were seriously only in it to shower change and sleep??) The bar on the beach is small but quaint. Off to one side is where the construction was taking place but they had it all blocked from view and the music they played was loud enough to make the construction seem non existent. The beers/drinks were cheap- happy hour all day!!!! There is a large gay presence but if your not a total homophobe then there are no problems. I didn't see ANY innapropriate behavior but still the atmosphere here is adult oriented ..don't bring the kids. Besides.. this is everyones vacation... not just yours :) Manny, Ivan and Carlos at the bar were very attentive..bring cash or you'll have to open a tab and pay a surcharge. I used my credit card though (with the money I saved on staying here I didn't have to budget so much on the extras) The Atlantic is RIGHT THERE..like steps away. It was AMAZING and so Relaxing!!! All the patrons were very friendly and we ended up hanging out with alot of people we met on the beach soakin up the beautiful sun during the day and bar hopping with them at night. My boyfriend and I had an amazing time!!!! If you are looking for hot tubs and all the luxury of the HYATT then don't stay here, but if your open minded, wanting to save some cash while staying at the BEST location.. then this is a great place to stay. We can not wait for the cold weather to return to our state so we have an excuse to get back to P.R. and we WILL definately to stay here again.. I've stayed at much nicer hotels in my life and i have had my issues with staff being rude, plumbing, noise levels, ect. but none of that seemed to really be an issue here. This was just our perception though... We rolled the dice ...and won. :)

Reviews.Title: “Aaaahhh Right on the Ocean”
Reviews.Author: Born_to_go61
Reviews.Content: You are steps from the Atlantic and what a nice beach. We have stayed in other boutique hotels here in San Juan and this one is closest to shops, restaurants, night life. Also a bus ride is 75 cents to Old San Juan City. Note: There is a night club next door, so if you go and sleep early, ask for a room on the side away from the club. It was loud on the weekends and after changing rooms, we heard nothing at all. There is a gay clientele, but it did not affect our visit and we never felt uncomfortable. There is no restaurant yet, but they are working on it and said that it would be opened in the summer.There are a couple of casinos and a weekend market place nearby. There is no free parking, but go into the hotel and they will take care of you and your car for 10 dollars a day. The staff here was very helpful and friendly. The rooms are small, but clean and there is a hair dryer! Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Location.location. Location”
Reviews.Author: scotthumb
Reviews.Content: Probably most notable thing is the majority of patrons are gay. It presented no problem for me. Everyone was very polite and respectful. You can walk up our down the beach fifty yards in either direction to hang with the straight crowd. Room was small but clean and comfortable. Staff was friendly and helpful. One note: the do not allow local guests up to the rooms. I talked to other guests who said there was no problem if a white visitor wanted to visit a guests room. This apparent policy was the only thing that left a bad taste in my mouth. Bar is being remodeled. Noise was never an issue. Large gaps under room doors meant lots of light and sound were always present. Location couldn't be better. Shopping, restaurants, casino, buses and beach is all right there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MCarson699
Reviews.Content: This is a no-frills hotel... don't go in expecting to be blown away. However, the location is great and the price is right. The rooms were small, but clean. The staff is nice, but you aren't going to be a prince staying here. The best part by far is the location, you can walk almost anywhere... we even walked to old San Juan, but we really like to walk! My biggest complain is it was a little noisy at night (just door closings and things like that, no partying).

Reviews.Title: “Why bother complaining....your in Puerto Rico!”
Reviews.Author: Pisces1979
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the third week of February 2012 for my birthday weekend with some family. We had a blast. I guess I am just not one to nit pick every little thing I figure I am on vacation and out of the country no less...who cares about the room as long as it is clean with no bed bugs its perfect to me....besides who plans on being in there more than a few hours to sleep. I could complain about the creepy elevator, the tiny bathroom and room(s), or even the little hut of a bar or the small amount of construction (which thankfully we stayed on the weekend so no work was being done), the varying cab ride prices, etc.. but why its all in the experience and none of it killed me so its nothing to get irate about. The hotel is in a perfect location you can get anywhere and if your brave the bus is like 75 cents!! and will take you anywhere just about. One thing I (we) didnt experience that most seemed to have experienced was rude customer service. I (we) were treated very well upon check in-during-and check out. Eddie was the best by the way! Also the other gentlemen who works at night he recommended a trip to the Old San Juan hotel....BEST PART OF THE TRIP! We had a great time there ...the casino...the live band...club Babylon!!! All and all it was a great birthday weekend and I would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Under construction !”
Reviews.Author: Jensans83
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I planned aast minute getaway here for a few nights. We booked here because it seemed liked the best value. We opted for the ocean view room with 1 double & 1 twin, which worked out perfectly. There is no control over the heat/ac in the rooms, so be prepared for cold/ hot temps while sleeping. The location was amazing, walking distance too tons of bars && great restaurants ( try pinky's for breakfast, a few blocks down / great grilled sandwiches!) The beach was lovely, plenty of chairs and umbrellas avivable. No pool which I was disappointed with. There was 10$ deposit to get s towel daily, which you get back when returned. The outside bar is rundown & the drinks are weak. They do have happy hour all day 12-11 can't complain about that! Also try to bring cash, there is a 15% surcharge fir credit cards. Carlos the bartender took good care of us! It was a 15$ taxi from airport to hotel, beware, they charge extra for every bag, crazy ! There is major construction going on at the hotel, looks like they're trying to revamp a restaurant in there, as of now there is no food on location. So we were woken up by drilling & hammering at 8am everyday. The elevator was scary one of the oldest/ most rundown ones I've ever seen. Upon checkout we were informed we were going to be charged an additional 20$/ night for the " extra person" we were never told about this fee, even after checking in & having us all sign numerous papers and taking copies of all three of our ids. There were three people behind the desk arguing with us making a scene. One man told the other man " just charge it! Just charge it!" horrible customer service, leaving a bad taste in our mouths while leaving....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean, comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: mirmtab
Reviews.Content: From reading the reviews I was expecting the worst, and instead was pleasantly surprised. Booking can only be done through their website. I personally like to speak to a person, but the online reservation was quick and easy. Check-in was easy enough. We were part of a large group and I could feel that they were a little overwhelmed. However, they were fast and efficient, and we were able to quickly access our room. The room was small, but it served our purposes. We weren't there to lounge in our room all day. We just needed a clean and comfortable place to sleep for the night as a stopover before our cruise, and this place was perfect for that. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. No complaints there! Be ready to leave at or before checkout time. They had a lot of people coming in, and were calling us to make sure we would be able to checkout on time. The people at the desk were helpful with any questions, and assisted us with getting taxi service the couple times we needed it. The lobby and bar were relaxing and comfortable. Sit with a cocktail and enjoy the beautiful view of paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Nice hotel, under construction :(”
Reviews.Author: Cileyn H
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from our PR vacation, 03/1/12- 03/05/12.. Great location in the middle of everything you need, hotel is very clean, no smoking allowed, but you can smoke in the hotel bar which is fab!!! The bar has happy hour from 11am-11pm, $3.00 beers and $3.50 mixed drinks you will never go wrong. The onlt con to the hotel is you can't sleep!!!! They are under construction which it really never bothered me, im a heavy sleeper, but the front desk kepted calling housekeeping every single second and the phone was ringing non-stop that woke me up!!! :(( They should have 2 way radios to commicate. Besides that the hotel staff especially the bar guys were friendly and nice.. Will consider staying there again..

Reviews.Title: “Lacks customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Pacotilla
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location... Great. Here comes the bad part.We called to change reservation from 3 to 4 and they said everything would be fine but we get charge a little more per night. Ok great... No that's not what happened. We arrived and front desk said they do not have rooms for 4. We said we can sleep 2 in 1 bed. They charge us extra for the 4th, we walk into room and saw a twin and queen or king bed. How are 2 people going to sleep in a twin bed. I didn't get it. We surrender to it didn't fight the charge for extra person, rearrange the beds. By putting them side by side. We r trying to stay positive n make the best of it. We go out all day n arrive late. Expecting to sleep in.... No that's not going to happen with the drilling and hammering going on early in the morning. They were under construction. What??? Not relaxing at all. So we took ourselve onto the beach to gry to sleep there. I feel we were doing too much work just to try to relax and enjoy our vacation. The hotel kept on giving us obstecals to over come, instead of being accommodating. Marriott was only 2 block down with pool and better customer service.

Reviews.Title: “come for a drink, don't stay over.”
Reviews.Author: TravellersToday
Reviews.Content: Great location, terrible service and terrible tiny rooms. Paid for an "Ocean Facing" yet you don't face the ocean, the bed has it's back to the tiny windows. It is a pity, since this place has so much potential. Great lobby and beach bar area. This is a gay friendly hotel judging by the crowd. Nice music with a relaxed scene. Come here for a drink, DO NOT STAY. Extremely rude gentleman with a tiny mustache at the front desk. Asking for anything is pointless, as he is completely useless. Our room was very noisy and freezing from a permanent AC with no "off" button.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: JoeyCS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a trip to San Juan and we stayed 5 nights at Atlantic Beach Hotel. The location is perfect - right on the beach and in the heart of Condado. Plenty of good restaurants, casinos and shops to choose from in the area, along with a bus stop right up the street (75 cents one way to Old San Juan on either the B21 or C23 buses - beats the price of a taxi). The room (double bed, non-ocean front) was very small, but we've stayed in Puerto Rico before and in older hotels this is just par for the course. The room was very clean, with fresh paint and bedding. Hotel bar overlooks the ocean and has great happy hour prices. During the weekend the bar was a more popular spot but during the week it was quiet and relaxing. The front desk set up a rainforest tour for us and it was affordable, professional and very enjoyable. All in all we had a great experience and would recommend the hotel to laid-back, open-minded people looking to have a good time in a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Major construction taking place- Be careful when they place you!”
Reviews.Author: downtownsml
Reviews.Content: I recently staying at the hotel- when I checked in I was given a room on the second floor. When I got to the room on Sunday afternoon it was a small but nicely renovated room with a ocean view. On Monday morning around 7:00am - the construction crew arrived. I had fallen asleep with my curtains open and when I heard noises I saw the work crew right outside my window. The noise was so loud and having these workman outside my window was very disturbing. I am shocked that the hotel did not mention this to us upon check in- it appears that the construction has been going on for sometime. When checking out I asked to speak with the Manager and was told he had left for the day. I have called him 4 times since arroving home and still he is not availabe and will not return my calll. I think this speaks to the quality of the hotel and the management. It is ashame that they chose to treat their customers this way as it is a well located and fairly priced hotel option in San Juan. Be careful.

Reviews.Title: “ItÂ´s a good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Alohanuiloa
Reviews.Content: I read many good reviews on Tripadvisor about this hotel so I knew what to expect. And I wasnÂ´t disappointed. The location is great: close (walking distance) to stores, restaurants, snack bars, casino, bus stop, a Walgreens (24/7), not to mention it is right on the beach (Condado beach) ! The room was nice and clean. Not too big but enough for a good night sleep. Bed is very comfortable. The people at the Front Desk were nice and helpful. The hotel has been undergoing a restauration but it didnÂ´t bother me at all as I was out most of the time. Should I go back to San Juan, I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is 0 stars”
Reviews.Author: yaidy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Atlantic Beach Hotel Iam from PR. Their lobby was newly renovated to compete against the modern beach bar/club that had opened next door. The hotel gave the illusion of being a clean place to stay; that was soon to be proven false! Let me start by saying I have never stayed in such a dirty hotel but for the sake of saving thirty bucks Â I went against my better judgment and decided to stay once I saw the incredibly tiny room. The images that are shown of the rooms are not what you actually get when you stay here. The halls had filth everywhere and a significant amount of mold was present around the bathroom! I was willing to overlook this and stay since I had paid in advance for the room on-line and believed it to be nonrefundable. The location is great, right on the beach, but so are a number of large very clean chain hotels for slightly more per night. Spend the extra few dollars and stay at one of those! Reviews.Title: “RUDE SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: boricua7919
Reviews.Content: guy in the lobby is EXTREMELY rude. he seems mad and bitter all the time. bad bad service.

Reviews.Title: “horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Bella M
Reviews.Content: I would never stayed here again,The plan was to celebrate my son birthday, my cust and friend wedding, and spent time with friends and family.we lasted 2 days worst Cust Serv. I have ever experience, place under construction they wake you up at 6am they dont even let you know. no security, no hair dryers, no restaurant, water leak never ending. and the CRAZY GUY at the desk, yelling at us like, we were criminals, and making us feel like we were robbing the place. asking for ID every time we came from outside. Too loud at night people slamming doors. you feel like they are inside your room. we end up going to el San Juan beach hotel 10 times better pleasant people, beautiful view and everything was at our disposes. and we made it to the Wedding on time. en La Concha.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting Hotel, Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer K
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in the beginning of December. We had booked two nights however left after 1 and went down the street to La Concha (which is a beautiful resort). The rooms were tiny and disgusting in this hotel without a safe. The location is decent but nothing could make up for the horrendous customer service. I have never been treated so rudely during a stay (by the man at the front desk with a French Accent). Stay away from this hotel; go down the street & spend a couple extra bucks and enjoy being pampered at La Concha.

Reviews.Title: “We love Atlantic Beach Hotel Staff!”
Reviews.Author: bwrigh10
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and I just finished up a three week vacation in Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands. Two weeks of which was spent staying at the Atlantic Beach Hotel. First and foremost, we must say that the staff is unbelievably friendly and accommodating. By the end of our trip we felt as if they were old friends that we had been visiting. Thank you for that! The hotel location is absolutely prime. It is on the beach, within walking distance to anything on the Condado and very close to Public Transportation to get you to Old San Juan. The newly renovated lobby looks absolutely beautiful and we cannot wait for the new bar to be finished. We will have to make a trip back to just to try it out! :-) As it is now, there is a large patio and a small bar that conducts happy hour from 12pm through 11pm. Very affordable! Construction being previously mentioned, it is necessary to point out that at this time there is a fair amount of loud construction noise. This noise lasts from very early in the morning and through out the day in to the evening. Furthermore, when the hotel is full the hallways are very loud. You can hear any conversation taking place as if it is in your own room. This was not good when we were calling it a night and our neighbors weren't coming in until 4 am. We were woken every time. Our first room was absolutely beautiful. Very Large room with an ocean view, very clean and updated. However, when we returned from our trip from the Virgin Islands the promotional rate was over, so we opted out of the ocean view. The room that we were put in was, again, very clean and updated, BUT it was no bigger than a medium sized walk-in closet. No Bueno! Overall, our trip and stay at Atlantic Beach was ideal. It was affordable, with a nice staff, and clean rooms. This was out second stay and I am positive we will continue to stay with them. The construction noise can be overlooked, because alas, it will soon be over. Thank you Atlantic Beach Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, clean room!”
Reviews.Author: Noel K
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just went on our honeymoon. We sailed on a cruise out of San Juan, Puerto Rico and had to stay one night in San Juan before we flew back home. I research many hotels before we left for our trip. We almost stayed somewhere else instead of the Atlantic Beach Hotel and I am so glad that we didn't. The Atlantic Beach hotel was walking distance to shopping and restaurants. It is located right on the beach. Has a great Happy Hour (but not over crowded). Newly renovated lobby and rooms. Everything was very clean. The elevator could us some work but overall friendly staff. They even gave us an early check-in since we were on our honeymoon and gave us a nice room on the top floor. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The rooms are not terribly big but that didn't matter for us. Oh yeah...the rate was the best I found in all my research.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rikki A
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights during the on-season and I could not have been happier with my choice. The hotel is in an incredible location next to places to eat, casinos, public transit to Old San Juan, and its right on the beach. The staff was friendly to me each day as I left the hotel to explore the city and they were very helpful in answering questions and ordering cabs. While the hotel is under construction, the work they've done so far makes a bit of tapping that starts at 9:30am okay. Yes, the rooms are small, but if I wanted to sit in my room all day I would have booked at a nicer place down the road. If you're coming to San Juan with realistic expectations and you don't plan on sitting in the room all day, the this is the hotel for you. I only give it 4 stars because I would have loved to use the beach bar, but unfortunately it was under construction during my stay. For the location and the price, this place can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: roger b
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 weeks in San Juan. The hotel is changing with a new lobby, but keeping the best hotel staff in town. You will feel like you just came home. Best bar if you like the beach. Rooms are being remodeled. Walking distance to everything including public transit to old San Juan. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “This review (is in my personal opinion) could save your vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: FrqntTrvlr41
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Atlantic Beach Hotel for several nights during my very recent trip to Puerto Rico. Their lobby was newly renovated to compete against the modern beach bar/club that had opened next door. The hotel gave the illusion of being a clean place to stay; that was soon to be proven false! Let me start by saying I have never stayed in such a dirty hotel but for the sake of saving thirty bucks (compared to the big chain beach hotels next door), I went against my better judgment and decided to stay once I saw the incredibly tiny room. The images that are shown of the rooms are not what you actually get when you stay here. The halls had filth everywhere and a significant amount of mold was present around the bathroom! I was willing to overlook this and stay since I had paid in advance for the room on-line and believed it to be nonrefundable. The location is great, right on the beach, but so are a number of large very clean chain hotels for slightly more per night. Spend the extra few dollars and stay at one of those! I later changed to a room with a view that was big enough for two adults to move in and paid extra for it, but mold was still an big issue in the new room, again I tried to not let that bother me too much. The Atlantic Beach Hotel is doing construction on the roof and on another floor (it only has 4 stories of hotel rooms), and on the second night their workers started jackhammering at 7:15 AM! This happened on my third night as well, so I finally decided to politely say something to the only employee working there at that time. They looked surprised. Why? They could clearly hear the banging from the lobby for themselves. I was given a quick and insincere apology. The next morning the workers starting hammering an hour earlier, at 6:15 AM!!! I then complained to an employee who was there most of the time (who locals later told me was the owner) and they just stared at me blankly. I told them this was unacceptable and that guests should have been warned so they could negotiate a refund and make other arrangements, at least do not charge me for the useless upgrade. I was told I got a 50% off promotional rate (NOT TRUE); locals told me that what I was paying was NOT half off and that I was being lied to again. The entire staff became incredibly rude and aggressive towards me because I dared to stand my ground and complain. Never have I experienced such an unprofessional attitude, especially from a service oriented business. When I asked for the ownerâ€™s name (I pretended to not know who it was), I was told that a corporation owned the hotel, and the only number available was to the hotelâ€™s front desk. All lies, just like many of the locals nearby had come to tell me. I never even got an apology from the owner or the rude staffâ€¦. just lies. I have a dispute pending with my Credit card company against them. You will not get your money back nor will you get hospitality at this hotel! Save yourselves the grief and stay anywhere else but this dive.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: tjohnson_11
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel I was looking for a value priced hotel and I was working with a budget of about $100.00 per night. I had read the reviews and it was typical of the reviews that I read for budget properties. I have stayed in many budget properties and generally give little regard to comments pertaining to being treated rudely by staff, dirty rooms etc. Of all of the budget hotels I have stayed in only one of them has truly earned that reputation, and the Atlantic Beach hotel is not one of them. As long as the reviews don't mention bed bugs I will give the place a try, There was no mention of bed bugs, so I went ahead and booked this reservation. I paid $79.00 for an ocean view room located directly on the beach in a hotel/tourist area of San Juan (The Condado area). One thing that should be mentioned is that this hotel is gay friendly. From my observation, the hotel does have a large gay clientele. If this is a problem and you are not going to be comfortable in this environment then don't book here. We were a group of 2 straight couples and my thoughts were that if the place is safe for gays it will be safe for straights. My first impression of the hotel upon entering was that it reminded me of many of the Miami South Beach boutique hotels. It was light and airy with the back entrance completely open and leading into the patio bar area overlooking the beach. Contemporary couches and coffee tables furnish the lobby. The check in was as per the reservation and I found the staff who checked me in to be friendly and helpful. I was given an oceanview room with one queen bed. The only thing that I would agree with regarding some of the reviews I read is that the elevator is absolutely ancient and there is a scare factor involved in using it. We were on the 4th floor so I would take it up, but took the stairs for the trips down. It also had a strong musty odor that necessitated breathing through the mouth for the trips that I did use for when going up. The room itself was fine. The queen bed was very comfortable and the bedding was white duvet. Loved it. The windows opened letting the ocean breeze into ,the room. There is a flat screen plasma tv that is wall mounted and the rest of the room furnishings were sparse. There was a desk and 2 chairs and a side table. The art and lamps were fairly new and the smoke detector did appear to be in working order. The bathroom for sure is small, but the shower is big enough for 2. I was relieved to find a good blow dryer in the bathroom as well. The room that we occupied was noisy in that it was located next to the air conditioning unit. Rule of thumb when travelling. Bring earplugs. The noise from the a/c did not bother me but my husband was aware of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Not That Great a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Love_2_Travel_djkljd
Reviews.Content: As the title says the hotel is in a great location, right on the beach, but it has many problems. Construction has been going on for years, you couldn't even get in the main entrance when I was there (see attached picture). You had to squeeze between parked cars with your big luggage, walk sideways in the gutter, and enter thru the back beach entrance where the bar is. I checked in and headed towards the infamous elevator. It is indeed quite scary. Tiny, dark, rickety, and the door had problems. The door doesn't even open all the way. It opened about 16 inches. My suitcase was wider than the elevator door opening. I had to turn it sideways to get it thru the elevator door. I got to my room, which was a remodeled ocean view room. The temp and lighting was OK in there, but there was one small problem - ANTS!!!! A whole conga line of ants was running along the window sill non-stop. Right above the bed. I didn't want to wake up covered in ants, so I went downstairs to complain. The guy said "Someone must have been eating in there". Eating on the 4 inch window sill? Needless to say I switched rooms. My new room was also an ocean view room. It had no ants but it was also darker and hotter. It was missing a light the other room had. Also there is no way to control the temperature in your room. You are at the mercy of whatever the hotel thinks the hotel temp should be. The manager told me to check the vents and see if someone closed them. How do I check them? They are 10 feet up. I stood on a chair. There is no way to adjust the vents. I had to get some long tweezers and stick them in there hoping I wouldn't drop them into the abyss. I was able to adjust them some but it still stayed too hot in there. I had trouble getting to sleep from the loud music being played in the hotel next door (which looked nicer than this one). No room in the bathroom for your stuff. I had to set some on top the toilet. Overall I would not stay here again and can't recommend it. It's cheap, but you get what you pay for. Spend a little extra and stay somewhere nicer.

Reviews.Title: “New look-Refurbished”
Reviews.Author: JG1203
Reviews.Content: I just arrived and despite the pictures and some comments i am very surprised: The hotel has been refurbished: A new and sylish bright lounge look. Congratulations. (work 95% finished - [11th Dec.2011] some minor painting still going on. just ready for peak season). Comparing with the old pictures - also the bathrooms of the guest rooms have been rebuilt. The stuff is friendly and supportive, and they arranged me a room eventhough i meesed up the online reservation - there is WiFi in the lobby (- the sigal on the room is too waek). However: The rooms have not become bigger and are still kind of minimalistic. I got a room to the side street. There is no good view - and it was not noisy at all. And in San Juan.... you don't need to spend your day in a hotel room. All in all: the face lift was worth it. The Lobby and the terrace is beautifull. You have really good deal: fair price for a small room.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to complete construction”
Reviews.Author: jacrolls
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times in the past 25 years, it has changed alot. In the old days it was great, with Stars Disco on the roof and a great Bar and restaurant for breakfast and lunch .After the disco closed and they made it into a penthouse apartment I stayed there, but it is now under construction as are alot of the rooms and bar/restaurant. The price was very reasonable and the new room was nice, but needs a shelf in the bathroom. The staff seem to be helpful, but the hotel had no information on what to see and do in the area. Also did not like the policy that you could not invite guest to your room. There were very few people around the hotel or on the beach, which use to be very busy.

Reviews.Title: “Clean small rooms noisy place with unfriendly stuff”
Reviews.Author: tatyana0203
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel two days after my cruise jus to explore old San Juan. I wish I've read reviews. The room was so tiny that we couldn't move around the room. We stayed prior our cruise at San Juan Beach Hotel at the same Condado location and the room was really spacious with table chairs and huge two beds Here at Atlantic just tiny twin beds and TV stand and tiny bathroom. The major complain was the noise from construction. They started drilling hotel walls at 7 am what was horrible when you are on vacation and and you cannot sleep in the morning. When I complained about it to the owner he ignored me completely and walked away. The lobby was a construction mess and elevator was super ancient. The stuff was so unfriendly that we had to ask construction people to help us with our lugage and elevator. My advise - stay away from this place unless you are a gay that's maybe the only reason to stay there. Stay at San Juan Beach- you'll get better deal for lesser money

Reviews.Title: “If only I read the reviews....”
Reviews.Author: Ross R
Reviews.Content: DON'T CHECK-IN TO THIS HOTEL..I should have read the reviews before I booked,we're couple from NY w/ friends from Chicago and SF visiting PR after a week cruise,we arrived in the counter with a very stern unfriendly 1 staffed hotel priced equivalent to neighboring hotels along the shoreline,the place has no parking space and the staff were rude(we rented a car)my friends were checked in at double tree(i should have stayed there-nice) and they were asked rudely if they are sleeping overnight instead of ushering us in and welcoming us,they gave us this 2 rooms and my room I reserve is beachfront but it's weekend they gave me a room with a laundryview at the back and will not compromise,the construction is going on until midnight and starts early am at 6am waking us up,the towels are worn out and the elevator is old and we're stuck on the middle of the floor with our luggage and we have to jump/climb up to the floor not mentioning it's squeaky scary riding in a lift that's noisy and shaky,we rested on the beach using their folding bench and were told we can't use them because they have to keep it at 5pm though they gave us until 5:30 pm.room is small and dusty from the construction going on,some areas are blocked going to the bar and we have to get out to enter the lounge/bar area.staff are so unwelcoming.2 of our friends visited us and were not allowed to enter our room and accused them of being prostitutes.has bucket of ice in our room but no ice to get it from,no water,,,has shampoo and conditioner dispenser but empty and we're given soap bar instead.seems like nobody understands English,we asked for a towel but were given face cloth.the place is so noisy at night,no food available,we can't go out because of the heavy rains.we wanted to check out early but won't refund our money.I regret going to this hotel after a 6 day perfect caribbean cruise,our vacation culminated in a very unpleasant stay in this hotel,,this Hotel SUCKS,,don't patronize ATlantic Beach Hotel in Condado,San Juan,PR,never,never,never

Reviews.Title: “great place to visit or stay”
Reviews.Author: caribbeanlifestx
Reviews.Content: after reading negitive reviews i decided not to stay at atlantic beach hotel... after visiting the bar there and the great beach that it is located on i really wished i would have stayed there instead of a nearby hotel a few blocks away that was more expensive since i spent most my time at A B hotel there is some construction still going on during the day but everything that has been done looks great and when finished will be a "hot spot" in condado for sure i would go there in the afternoon and the noise was not so bad i started my night there and then would go "out and about" then would finish my night there the views looking over the beach is great, so many hot bodies on sat and sunday afternoons on the gay beach, just unreal, there is a upscale club next door called oceano that was a bit to snooty for my tastes and 2 blocks over another gay club "cant remember the name" that is pretty cool every day i went to A B Hotel and the staff... from the owner, managers, bartenders were welcoming and friendly even tho i was not a hotel guest when you go there you MUST make friends with the 2 main bartenders... carlos "the very very sexy hard working thin one" and ivan "the butch one that will give you a great haircut if you need one" and take you to late night clubs he promotes both those guys are the absolute best and will give you all the local info you need tell carlos you want to see pics of his huge dog... its bigger than he is next time i visit san juan i will be staying there without a doubt

Reviews.Title: “disgusting!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chris C
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property before and had good experiences. However this last time i stayed there was absolutely horrible! Having flown in from Los Angeles we reserved a ocean view room. The room we were given was a partial ocean view, and a view of a disgusting torn down abandoned building next door. Our room was filled with mold which the front desk said was normal this time of year. The staff was extremely rude when i asked to change rooms. (they did not change rooms for us). when i disputed the claim with my credit card company, they lied in writing saying they escorted us to the rm before checking in to make sure it was satisfactory. That was a LIE!!! we also had a late checkout and having told the front desk upon checking in, was assured that someone is there 24hrs a day to check us out. You deposit $10 per towel when you arrive and upon returning of the towels you get your cash deposit back. when we checked out (late) they said they have no access to money that late and could not refund my deposit. They also LIED! once again to my credit card company saying i recieved my deposit back! This place is disgusting and should not be santiary enough to be operating!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE EVER!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: loliz1
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying the hotel has no parking and the street is very narrow and crowded by other cars, we were rudely told by a hotel employee to drive around until a parking space appeared! The front desk employee was really rude, no customer service etiquette what so ever, the place is not what is seems in the hotel website pics, the rooms are horrible and the lobby is a nightmare, it's a total scam! We didn't even last 30mins after our check in once we saw the room and asked for an upgrade or our money back the front desk employee literally insulted us, told us if we didn't like it there was the door, refused to give us his name (who by the way had no uniform or name tag) and refused to get a manager, we were told he was the manager! The next day i called to talk to hotel management and they were even ruder, didn't seem to care about my complaint almost seemed as I were talking to same hotel employee!! Its a shame such a horrible place exists in such a beautiful island and a great area (Condado PR) I ADVISE ALL THESE UNSATISFIED CUSTOMERS TO DO A REPORT ABOUT THIS HOTEL WITH WHO EVER IS PROMOTING THEM (ONLINE, WEBSITE, TRAVEL AGENCY, ETC...) I ALREADY DID MYSELF WITH EXPEDIA, ORBITZ, THE DEPARTMENT OF TURISM AND DACO THEY CANNOT KEEP GETTING AWAY WITH THIS!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: Claramartinez
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I ever stayed. Customer service was awful. The manager in charge was disrespectful.

Reviews.Title: “This place is trash. I was completely outraged!”
Reviews.Author: izzy1696
Reviews.Content: First off, the hotel looks NOTHING like what their site depicts. I'm originally from PR, and being gay, and on vacation, I thought I'd be nice to stay at this hotel during my visit to San Juan. Well, I checked out 20 minutes after I got there (I would have left immediately if the supervisor had been more cooperative). As I walked in and saw the catastrophe of a lobby, I immediately asked the â€œhousekeeping supervisorâ€� for a refund. The housekeeping supervisor was the only person working at this hotel and was completely and utterly unprofessional. He advised me that since I had already booked the room online I could not get my money back. I am currently filing a complaint with my credit card company in order to get my money back. But either way, I would have never stayed at such a dirty place. The lobby looks like a war zone. The supervisor looks like he had just crawled off a dumpster. The room was small, dirty, outdated, with dirt and blood on the sheets, and no amenities whatsoever. The room was not even air conditioned. The condition of the room and this hotel was completely unacceptable; I would not even imagine a motel being this dirty and unkempt. I would not advise anyone to stay here. As I said, I am still currently trying to get my money back and the only person to contact is the dirty supervisor working the nasty front desk; completely unbelievable. I ended up staying at La Concha, which was beautiful and I would highly recommend staying there. However, do not make the mistake of booking the â€œAtlantic Beach Hotelâ€� onlineâ€”it is not as depicted on their photos. If I had the time and energy, I would sue this place. They are building a place next door which looks more promising called â€œOceanaâ€� and is set to open sometime Sept 2011. The location of this place is great ... You just need to blow it up to pieces and start over with a new owner.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff but facilities belong in the "hotel junkyard"”
Reviews.Author: fitzlpatrick
Reviews.Content: As many reviews have previously stated, renovations are currently being undertaken and according to the hotel manager, are slated to be completed in December, 2011. I was in a non-ocean front room which appeared to have not yet been renovated, though the furniture and fixtures appeared to be new. Bed was extremely comfortable and flat screen TV was nice. Pros: location friendliness and helpfulness of staff beachfront bar proximity to shopping and other areas hotel has its own generator so power is uninterrupted in the event of power outages due to storms, etc. Cons: 1) bathroom was moldy and had a window which would not fully close - as a result, I had to keep the bathroom door shut all the time so that the air conditioning in the room did not leak out through the open window 2) no restaurant or way to get coffee at the hotel - luckily, a starbucks is 2 blocks away 3) construction on renovations started every morning at 7 a.m. ---- extremely noisy 4) room itself was very small 5) elevator was ancient and a little scary to ride - i took the stairs most of the time

Reviews.Title: “U pay for what you get!”
Reviews.Author: Liz C
Reviews.Content: The hotel was undergoing construction when I went in June 2011! The hotel price was cheap and its in front of the beach! It's an old hotel and some items don't work like the elevator, door knob. The staff were helpful, but parking was horrible!!!!! Also this hotel is known in Puerto Rico as the gay hotel. I wanted to pay cheap and I had a decent stay! This hotel is safe and near a few restaurants in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: AbigRod
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from 9/3 to 9/4. The hotel is still undergoing renovations so the lobby is an eyesore. The elevator and stairs is also in bad shape so it gives the place a 1 star feeling. The staff also speaks little English so communication can involve some guess work. On the plus side the rooms were basic but clean and you really can't beat the location for the price. The hotel is really right on the beach. There are plenty of restaurants and shops within walking distance. There is also a Wendys, Walgreens and Dunkin Donuts within a 10 minute walk from the hotel. There are plenty of cops around so you do feel safe. Nightlife was ok in this area but if you really want to get more options you should go to Old San Juan which is about a 10 minute ride from the hotel. If u take a taxi make sure you ask for the fare before getting in. I had an experience where the hotel staff told me the fare would be around $12. Â I asked the taxi driver how much and he said $20. I told him I heard it was 12 and he quickly said yes 12 :) they are known to overcharge naive tourists.Â

Reviews.Title: “Lies, Violence, and Threats”
Reviews.Author: AtLeastBeDecent
Reviews.Content: Atlantic Beach Hotel PO Box 16876 San Juan PR 00908-6876 Complaint Description: I checked into the Atlantic Beach on Friday the 2nd and checked out Saturday the 3rd. I have a $187 authorization on my CC, $86 of which is for the room and the other $100 was a hold which I was told twice would be removed within 48 hours guaranteed. I made sure to ask because I am flying in three days and need the money to pay for my luggage. My CC company told Atlantic Beach to simply send a fax to the CC company saying they authorized the release of the $100. When I went to check on the situation and give the employee the information to send to the CC company he refused, then refused to give me the manager's name or his name! THEN, when I (5'9" 150 skinny guy) told him that the hotel was holding my money hostage he came from behind the counter with a big stick and threatened to hit me with it. I don't know if there are cameras there or not but I swear to God this man (I was able to find out he is a Cuban man named Eric or something similar) came at me with a stick (which is prbably still behind the counter) and when my CC company called him after he continually hung up on my calls he refused to fax the info for the release of the hold. The threat of physical violence against me and the refusal to return my $100 hold after a week when I was told it would be back in the acccount within 48 hours when I left the room squeaky clean is unacceptable, especially since I stay in hotels in San Juan all the time and many don't even use the CC hold. The hotel is refusing to help in any way and I am without the money I need, and the threat of beating me with a stick is incredibke. I was going to call the police but he told my friend who was with me at the hotel that he was calling a group of his friends to come so we left.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT TAKE YOUR FAMILY HERE! IT'S OLD, RUN DOWN, RENOVATIONS SUCK!”
Reviews.Author: Kim S
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family at the Atlantic Beach Hotel for three nights. The hotel is still going through renovations, particularly in the lobby area; however, this does not get in the way of hotel guests. We were on the 4th floor and had an ocean view. We were actually in the double room as there was a front door for rooms 410 and 411. Each room was on opposite sides of each other and had itâ€™s own door with a bathroom in the middle. The bathroom did not have a real door just a thin, flimsy sliding door, so it's not that useful if you are traveling with friends or other family members and would want real privacy as you shower or use the bathroom. Plus, you needed the key for the front door to enter the room 410/411 area and also for each individual room. If you mistakenly closed your room door while going to the bathroom, you would lock yourself out of your room if you did not bring the key to the bathroom with you. Itâ€™s a strange set up. I was charged higher than what is listed on the web site since I had one of the largest rooms. Our view was of the ocean and since we were on the 4th floor, we were not bothered by the very loud music being played nightly at the bar. However, be prepared for the music to last past midnight and be sure to request an upper floor if at all possible. Nor, could we hear the construction during the morning hours. Based on the reviews I read before traveling to this hotel, I knew to ask for the "upgraded" room. While our room was upgraded, it was also built as the handicap room; however, it was fully functional for us. The room was very clean and seemed newly renovated. The floors were beautifully tiled, as was the entire bathroom and shower. The walls were freshly painted and very clean, pure white. However, since this is a boutique hotel, they did take some shortcuts. There was no flat screen tv, only an older tube box. Also, besides the new headboard and sideboard for the bed, the dresser and night stand looked to be from before they renovated the hotel. Both were very old and dated looking. The room was very plain. One small dresser, one very small closet and two night stands with two very well used, not so clean lamps on them. Now, here are my real complaints. Because this is a small, boutique style hotel, I believe they are taking way too many shortcuts for the price one pays. They need to tweak a few details, for example: -Our room had two large towels and only one face towel in the closet, not bathroom. They were stingy to give more towels and would only provide one additional face towel since some towels were already in the room. -We did not have even one bar of soap in our room when we arrived, which is just ridiculous. Every room should be prepared in the same way. -One lamp was so old that it would not turn off unless you unplugged it. -In the bathroom, there was no holder for the toilet tissue. The roles were stacked on the toilet's tank lid. That is just vulgar. -You are subject to the air conditioning they decide to blast or turn off for the entire building, so it goes from freezing to humid and hot, back to freezing throughout the day and night. -There are no phones in the room, only a stupid hall phone...that's just stupid. Make sure you take your cell phone or else forget about it. -There is no personal shampoo, conditioner or lotion for guests. There are two dispensers that were filled who the heck knows how long ago with shampoo and conditioner to use, but thatâ€™s disgusting too. Yuck. So, really the only comfortable thing about the hotel was that the room and bathroom were both clean. The convenience to the beach is nice; however, it's a filthy beach. Everyone seems to be littering regrettably. The extra time is not taken by the hotel's staff to make sure each room is prepared for guests prior to their arrival. Toilet tissue should have a proper holder and not be stacked on top of the tank like some disgusting public bathroom. That's lazy, inconvenient and very vulgar. Guests should have adequate amounts of soap and towels already in the room, and be provided what they require throughout their stay regardless of how many towels were already in the room. I never asked for housekeeping services to clean my room while there because I did not want to be possibly charged a fee for whatever. After requesting soap and only allowed one more face towel, I saw how unprepared, cheap and stingy they were, I did not want to possibly in anyway acquire any service fees to be charged to my room. The Vendig Street this hotel is located on is not a place necessarily for families. It is filthy as is the beach this hotel is located directly next to. Itâ€™s very urban, which means it's dirty and not a place you would want to walk after sunset with your family. There was a huge pile of smelly trash that stayed on the sidewalk even after the trash collectors came. No one ever picked it up and I'm sure if you go there today, you'll see a pile of trash to the left of the hotel that will still be there. If you are not willing to pay a little higher for a view of the ocean, with the hotel being as small as it is with only 5 floors, your view will be horrible. There will not be a beautiful city view at all. The street is very narrow, so if you do not have to drive there, I'd recommend that you do not bring a car. The area is very urban and very, very gay friendly. I had read that before I came, but was really surprised how gay friendly it is. This is their beach, so just be prepared if you are bringing family members who find that lifestyle unacceptable. When I say it is their beach, I seriously mean it. If you do not respect that lifestyle or live it, this will be quite a surprise. Everyone is super friendly, but you do have to prepare yourself if you are not used to seeing the gay lifestyle outwardly in public. Condado is the gay South Beach, gay Greenwich Village of Puerto Rico. I adore Puerto Rico and hope to return. However, this hotel is not worth the $89 to $118 ocean view price...not at all. The renovations truly suck because they are not renovating the entire building, hallways, rooms, etc. Go to a major chain, find a deal on hotwire or wherever and do not stay here. They have put no work into the old elevator, which we did not take. They have put minimal work into the hall ways. They need to do a ton more. San Juan is full of boutique hotels that are super fabulous and this one has potential, but I think they are cutting too many corners and will never be able to compete with the other nicer boutique hotels in the area until they take the extra effort in making sure every room is prepared properly and that down to the even the smallest details of each room, things donâ€™t go ignored. No one wants to see no holder for toilet tissue in their bathroom and no soapâ€¦thatâ€™s simply disgusting and very lazy on their part. If they are not checking the quality of each room after the room has been cleaned, there are no checks and balances, and that shows. It also makes you wonder, how â€œcleanâ€� was the room really? It appeared clean, but as I said if the manager or a housekeeping supervisor is not checking the quality of each room after cleaned, especially in such a small hotel, then this is questionable. Iâ€™ve seen that done in other hotels in Puerto Rico where we had to wait for the supervisor to approve the cleanliness and the overall preparation of our room before we could even enter. Again, they are cutting too many corners and whoever the owner is, he or she is not taking the extra time to really make this hotel one of a kind, nor making sure it is comparable to other boutique hotels that make you say, WOW! Thanks for reading. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you think..”
Reviews.Author: trish p
Reviews.Content: based off the pictures, I thought I had a steal for the price I was paying. Hotel lights didn't work, didn't get ocean view like I paid for and couldn't get a refund. People were however, the supervisor was conveniently gone when I asked for him. He was in the back relaying information to the person I was speaking with at the front desk. Poof hes gone when I ask for him. The pictures glorify this place. The rooms are tiny which is fine and I'm not at all a high maintenance person so fancy wasn't something I was looking for. I spent 1000.00 that day and went somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Well, there's a bit of history to explain the issues!”
Reviews.Author: Gringo-in-Paradise
Reviews.Content: Yes, I realize the staff seems rude and the owners seem a bit conflicted. You have to realize this hotel has been a gay icon for decades and the beach in front is still the big gay beach of the Caribbean. The owners tried to de-gay the place over the past couple of years but now they seem to be embracing their history and as a result the service and facilities are improving to match the new gay resort next door. Give them a chance. Our group of straight but gay-friendly folks just stayed and I can assure you it's well worth the price, the staff is trying, and the bartenders are the very best in the Condado area! Also, drinks are price appropriately...not outlandish like other bars on the beach. So, it's not perfect but definitely worth a visit. I plan to return in the next couple of months.

Reviews.Title: “Under construction, but did the job”
Reviews.Author: gol19
Reviews.Content: The pool and patio areas were under construction so we did not get to enjoy those. The facade and hallways looked run down, but the inside of the room was nice. The bathroom was clean and looked newly remodeled. It was small, but we only stayed one night. The location is great. You're right on the beach. There are bars and a dunkin' donuts nearby (very important for coffee addicts like me). For a short stay on a budget, it was great.

Reviews.Title: “A good deal for staying in the Condado District”
Reviews.Author: William M
Reviews.Content: Most certainly a real "diamond in the rough"! Just because the hotel is going through major renovations does not mean it is poor quality or a run down hotel. This place was worth staying in and it was a bargain compared to other places in the Condado District. I wanted a beach front hotel at an affordable rate, and I got that plus more than what I expected! I recommend this place to people that have an eye for style and are free-minded thinkers who enjoy staying at original and authentic places from the area that is being visited. The room I was placed in looked exactly like the picture! The hotel is situated right in front of the beach and you have 24hr access to it. There is a small bar in the patio open for guests to enjoy a drink while listening to the waves. The check in area, patio and pool area are under renovations. If you observe carefully what work that has already been done, you can immediately see that this place will look amazing later!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, plan to relocate there.”
Reviews.Author: roger b
Reviews.Content: Hotel was being remodeled, but that didn't cause any problems. Rooms were clean and quiet. TV had a good selection. Close to all transportation, including public for only 75 cents. Staff was GREAT. Very heplful, I felt like I was a regulat guest. Staff that included everyone from the owner to the housekeeper. Very safe. Great burger shop near hotel, Punk Burger Bistrol. Great, freindly staff there and great food at a good price. Reserve a lot of time for old San Juan, eat at Sr Frog, good food a lot of fun. The best thing about the PR is the people. I have traveled a lot, these folks make you feel like they want you there and it's your home. Do try out the hotel, it's no a 5 star, but it's clean, great staff(the best) the price is right and a great location. Tell them Roger referred you, they will make you feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Peefect to stay the night before your cruise.”
Reviews.Author: Ykgood
Reviews.Content: Not luxurious at all, Lobby is currently being renovated so first impression was "O, sheet rock walls" Concierge was nice and helpful. Room didn't have a main light just a lamp. The bathroom light however lit up the whole room. Checked for bedbugs, there were none. Sheets were nice and clean, bed was very comfy. Again nice under $100 for one night stays, perfect for those going on a cruise the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff rude!!! Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: leelouzon
Reviews.Content: We originally booked this hotel 2 months in advance via telephone. Upon arriving they did not have our reservation and told us they only take reservations online. A little nervous about the hotel because it was under remodeling/construction but it was late so we stayed anyway. The room was lovely and clean - a little scary getting there because the elevator is ancient. Beach fantastic.But the bar was not very good at all. Decided to stay another day (had an infant with us and didn't want to move to another hotel) and the rate we were told by the manager suddenly had gone up plus they tried to get me to sign a blank credit card charge slip. Upon check-out they billed me double for parking. Got in an altercation with the manager regarding additional charges but they could have cared less. Did notice that everyone checking in had some kind of problem with the manager. If you do stay there be very careful of what you are being charged for. Also, construction did not start until late morning, but have a feeling it is a very slow and ongoing process.

Reviews.Title: “Bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: creeplvr
Reviews.Content: First I will say we were a little sceptical reading previous reviews but said what the heck, let's go for it anyways because we felt the value (a beachfront hotel in the Condado area) was good...We stayed from the 2nd -6th and we honestly have NO complaints! our room looked like the room in the pics, we stayed in room 204 (looks like the ones psted here for April 2011) The room was clean and cool. Bed was comfy and sheets were clean. The bathroom was nice, small but nice. The water pressure was delightlful! never had an issue with no water or anything like that. Cable on a small flat screen mounted to the wall. It rained a little but it didn't stop our flow. Right on the beach which was a plus. Area was safe for walking around. Room service was on point. Beach lounges and umbrellas were set up with no problem. The staff was very helpful, not rude at all, well at least not to us. They gave us recommmendations, directions, called cabs with no problem at all. The bar was closed for the most part but it gave us a chance to go drink with the locals! We went to the one across from La Concha Resort and got wasted (shots were $2) then went across to La Concha and partied (their drinks started at $9) there is also a Walgreens, Haagen Daz, Subways, Dunkin Doughnuts for those that want a lil taste of home all within 2 blocks of the hotel. The cons: you have to pay a $100 deposit, which we were never informed about prior to, but we paid cash so were refunded when we checked out (which was such a fast easy process) and if you want a beach towel that is also a deposit. Also it seems to be a known gay beach, but it didn't bother us at all. Slushy island drinks were served to us on the beach for only $3 (liquor)and while we went to many referred restaurants the one we found to be the best was at a mom& pop spot called "Stop& Go" across the lil park from La Concha Resort (which is right next door & has a banging bar and casino) which we found strolling around, for a whole meal (rice, beans, meat, salad and drink) was $8! Orozco's was also a good on Ashford ave. Must go to Old San Juan for a taste of history, it won't dissapoint. We took a bus there for .75...All in all, you get what you pay for so if you don't set your expectations of a beachfront hotel room for under $100 too high then you won't be dissapointed! Yes they were remodeling the lobby and yes it wasn't dazzling but really, come on! this isn't a 5 star resort! We went with an open mind and because there were so many negative reviews we were prepared for the worst but definetely felt like we got the BEST! We plan on staying here again, but only as long as we can get the same room ;) Enjoy!!!! =)

Reviews.Title: “A Diamond in the Rough!”
Reviews.Author: LoneWolff
Reviews.Content: Just returned from San Juan and loved it. Stayed all 6 nights at the Atlantic Beach Hotel on Vendig St. From the moment of check in to our final adios, we were treated with kindness and smiles. The entire staff was great. This hotel is under construction so some noise is to be expected. It wasnt outragous. They are building a pool on site and renovating the lobby. Parking is $10 per day and SO VERY WORTH IT. Your rental will be locked up in a gate. Anytime you need to retrieve your car a staff member will unlock the gate. Parking on the street and the lot across the hotel would be risky and costly. I recommend this hotel as it is STEPS AWAY FROM THE BEACH. The rooms are VERY SMALL but nice. Recommend for adults and not good for families. (Rooms too small) When I return to San Juan, I would definately stay here again. It was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL STAY EVER #1”
Reviews.Author: MisterJP
Reviews.Content: (June 29 2011- July 6th 2011). DO not be confused by the pictures on the HOTEL'S website. My room looked nothing like that. Infact I looked in 3 different rooms and they looked nothing like that. That bar and deck area looked NOTHING like that, it wasnt even open when we arrived. When it finally opened it still looked nothing like the photo you see on the website. I added some pictures. Water shut off with NO NOTICE for hours. They only have 3-4 parking spots. The bathroom is tiny and the shower is a about 6 square feet. The pictures I posted was of our room #309 which was was the better of the 2 rooms in our crew. The bed was comfortable and hotel was kept cool. however the construction crew was not curtious to the guests. They started their work around 8am.

Reviews.Title: “The saying is true... You get what you pay for!!!”
Reviews.Author: mixedftw
Reviews.Content: I was reading a couple of reviews online before purchasing this trip. And most of them say it was good and bad... Now the hotel was under construstion LAST YEAR... So why did i show up to found. NOTHING had been done to my knowledge. It was like they barely begun. Put it this way you could walk in the hotel from the beach cause there was no door!! The rooms were ok... they were clean.. Our sink was stopped up for most of the stay 4 nights and leaky shower head. Room looked nothing like the pictures on the sites ( priceline... orbitz...etc) the room was still out dated with a big tube tv. Our friends room was the "UP TO DATE" room but it was 10x small and the view from the room was a shed with the construction tools were being held. Not a bad location everything from shopping to eating are located down & up the street. so thats not a bad thing. If you arent going to be in the room the whole trip and dont care about lil things ... then this is the hotel for you. but be aware its not what you think it is. and ur not a 1* hilton!!

Reviews.Title: “!!!DO NOT STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: satchit
Reviews.Content: Ok i basically dont write stuffs but now i have to. All these people who said its awesome and helpful staff, these all people are liers. May be they got paid or tjey are the hotel family who wrote these. Because the hotel is terrible and the customer service is worst i ve ever seen in my life. I nearly called police. I cheked in and then checked out the same day. Not for me, but for yourself stay AWAY from this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Condado Beachfront at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: CXJJ
Reviews.Content: We picked out the Atlantic Beach Hotel because it was right on the beach and very reasonably priced. The place is undergoing some construction that made the lobby look a little rough, but the small rooms are really nicely tiled and tastefully decorated. The real gem here is that staff are so helpful. From giving directions and advice to making sure that your beach lounge was ready for you on the beach, the staff were exceptional. If you have a rental car, I recommend that you use the $10 a night parking provided at the hotel -- you might want to reserve this.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but Clean !”
Reviews.Author: axel16
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very basic place right on the beach. Not large at all which is why I liked it. Room is very basic but everything was clean and this is what matters. Was fine for 3 nights and the price was cheap. So I enjoyed myself there. However I would upgrade to a fancier hotel if I was going to spend 5 nights in San Juan next time.

Reviews.Title: “This place us a DUMP - dirty, horrible customer service and RUDE STAFF !”
Reviews.Author: Dakinnyc
Reviews.Content: In town for memorial day weekend. This place is a DUMP with no form of basic service from it's staff. The desk agent overcharge me and actually lied to me saying there were additionally service charges. As I asked more questions it turns out he was just trying to cover himself for his inital lie. Just because in from out of town doesn't mean you can scam me. When finally confronted in the lie he walk away and said you can find the manager. RUDE!!!! Aditionally, the bathroom in the lounge was so filthy I could even walk in there with my shoes on. DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND STAY AWAY. WE DERSERVE BETTER TREATMENT.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: JC27
Reviews.Content: We were looking for an inexpensive oceanfront place to stay before a cruise. Atlantic Beach Hotel was undergoing lobby renovations and has a funky old elevator, but we were very pleasantly surprised overall. Our room was really small, but quite boutiquey with space enough for our stuff, a comfortable bed and a modernized bathroom. This hotel used to cater pretty much to the gay/lesbian crowd, and while that segment of the population was present, we (a hetero couple) were warmly welcomed and felt perfectly comfortable there. The staff were friendly and accommodating and for what we paid you could not beat the value on Condado Beach.

Reviews.Title: “We would never stay there again, even if they offered to pay us for staying”
Reviews.Author: ladykatherine1967
Reviews.Content: Great location. We booked two ocean view rooms. When we arrived they informed us that there was only one room available. The other room faced plaster wall. There was no appology offered. My husband tried to reason with the person saying that we paid for an ocean room view and was told that there were none available. Since it was only for one night we decided to stay and have a drink on the terrace. The hotel and the beach below was full of gay men some of them openly displaying affection and others almost making out in full view of everyone on the beach. After a couple of hours the desk clerk come over and informed us that he had one room with an ocean view and if we wanted to take it it would be additional twenty dollars plus tax. The hotel didn't have any service except the bar. No resturant, coffee machine or information where to find anything. The rooms were dark and smelled so we opened the windows just to get fresh air. The elevator was so old that we avoided using it for fear of being trapped. In the morning as my husband was still packing I went downstairs to check out but was informed that as long as my husband was still in the room we could't check out. I then joined our friends on the terrace to have a ciggarette. Shortly after my husband came downstairs and checked out I was called to the front desk and was informed that I would have to pay additional two hundred and fifty dollars because I was smoking in the room and it would costs that much to clean the room. Since this was my fourth trip to San Juan to go on a cruise and I was well aware of the smoking policy (I asked the bar tender if I was allowed to have a ciggarette on the terrace) can you imagane my surprise to being accused of something that I did not do. My husband and I traveled all around the world and have never been accused of something like this. I tried to reason with them but I guess that at this so called hotel the management is always right and they would not let me leave. they decided to lower the fine to one hundred dollars and if we wanted to get to our cruise we had to agree to pay it. I guess when they saw me smoking on the terrace they decided that I was an easy mark for extra cash. I DID NOT SMOKE IN THE ROOM and because our window was open it gave them easy way to obtain extra cash. Since my husband makes a living from people that do not obey the rules (he is a defence attorney) I would never put myslelf in a position that would affect his reputation. The managment acquired one hundred and twenty dollars extra just from us. I have to wonder how many other people found themselves in the same position. Because of our experience I would advise travellers to stay far away from this hotel and spend the extra money to stay at a reputable hotel. I know that we will and will also caution other people and tell them about our bad experience. The only reasn we stayed here was the fact that our two friend are on fixed income and they wanted to stay on the beach for their first trip to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad!”
Reviews.Author: kspirit1
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I made reservations before fully researching this spot and was a bit reluctant to stay here. I even had a list of backup hotels just in case I was really disappointed, but I was slightly surprised. Yes , I was prepared for the renovations, but it was good to see that the renovations were actively being done. I was under the impression that the renovations had been going on for years. If the renovations continue at this present rate, then next summer the place should be fabulous! Plus, there is a new hotel opening beside the Atlantic Hotel , so management must get their act together otherwise business will be lost.! My room was small ,but I really don't need much. Yes, the windows were filthy, but I as prepared for that . The bed resembled the one on the internet and it was so comfortable!!!! At one point I became slightly ill and it was nice to luxuriate in that bed. I slept easily. The management was very helpful. If I wanted to book a tour , more towels or anything. Reception /management was ready to assist. I arrived a bit early for check - in , the receptionist said " No problem.! IYour room will be ready in 15 minutes!" At the exact time, my room was ready! I was able to lie on the beach using the hotel's beach furniture. I enjoyed myself by watching the sunsets and sunrises. I am glad I stayed. here! Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay until the work is all done.”
Reviews.Author: jomofrank
Reviews.Content: Only thing this place has is that it is on the beach, other than that don't waste your dollars on this place unless the so-called "renovation" is done. Call ahead and check. The noise is unbearable. Beautiful view but that's it. If you want to take a chance don't take the room above the bar, I think it's more quiet out on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a good stay”
Reviews.Author: Househead
Reviews.Content: Well we arrived on a Tueday and were able to check in at around noon. The place itself looks a bit run down, especially by the bar. Just look at the cash registers! The room was clean for the most part, the most impt being the beddings and linens, which were comfy. The vents in the bathroom were filled with dust and it didnt look like it had been cleaned for awhile. Also, there was a tall lamp and the inside of it wasnt cleaned for god knows how long because, that too, was dusty and needed to be cleaned up. The lamp and vents did not affect our stay in a negative manner, just something I happened to notice. The location of the hotel is perfect, i mean the price you are paying to have an oceanfront room is really cheap if you think about it. Compared to other hotels price, you cant do much better. The view and the breeze is just amazing and you are steps away from the beach. The bar is open early and you get few people coming in and out during day,which is confusing because this place has the potential to bring in large crowds just bc of location and size of bar. i think they are missing out on a gold mine because they are not running the bar correctly and their could be a dj working the tables providing entertainment. The drinks, sad 2 say, were not potent enough.---really not even close...they were being measured as if they had limited liquor to ration! There is also too much security going on, locking hotel doors at night and having to wait for someone to come let you in. Really annoying. They need to simplify everything over there..They should realize that people are on vacation and allow visitors. I have many friends in Puerto Rico, none of which were able to come up 2 my room. Very disappointing,as though you are not a responsible adult LASTLY, dont use the elevator. We got stuck in it and it is a scary, antiquated elevator. I dont really think oceanfront hotels have to be 5 star. You are there for the beach, views, and location. I pointed out some of the issues we had, but for the most part i would stay again and am looking forward to doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Okay - but won't go back”
Reviews.Author: mmwatt930
Reviews.Content: The good points are - great location, clean, nice shower, decent price. The negatives - Only 1 lock on door, VERY small room, small bed for 2 grown people, small sink area, could hear every door open and close = awake many times during the night, scared of the elevator, view of water cisterns, no lobby area / under construction.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Clean hotel, great beach view”
Reviews.Author: marinemami
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Atlantic Beach Hotel for our vacation & it was nice. Clean & friendly staff. They were in the process of remodeling it the whole week we were there. Which was nice to see they were updating it. The rooms are updated & clean & rather nice. We wanted to spend more on shopping & site-seeing, than spending $ on a fancy hotel. Great value. It was a comfy bed & maid service was on point. Only place directly on the beach! Which we enjoyed! If your looking for a nice clean comfy place to stay go here. We enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable bed, quiet at night and nice sea view ...”
Reviews.Author: dalila73
Reviews.Content: One of the owner is french like me, we meet at the last moment, he was very friendly. The entrance is little cold, but I don't leave in the entrance, the room was very clean, nice sheet, pillow, hot water, comfortable bed. I went for smoking in the roof front of atlantic sea, so nice. Also there is, a hotel bar front the beach and the price they are good, and the personal friendly. I stayed there 2 nights. Just a surprise, but not a problem, there are many gays...

Reviews.Title: “one more great stay at Atlantic beach hotel”
Reviews.Author: maryse718
