Reviews.Content: Went to my favorite beach vacation spot,Puerto rico at the Atlantic beach Hotel; because I went few times to this place I was confident that I will be pleased; the staff is so nice,they always made sure I had everything I needed,from the beach chair to the beach towels,to help me with finding places to eat and ordering me cabs anytime I needeed; my room was always very clean ; could not have asked for more; I can't wait for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “i loved it”
Reviews.Author: malzie_89
Reviews.Content: i absolutly had a wonderful time there!! the people were all so kind. the room was a little small however the reviews i read i wsa terrified. the bartenders are very kind and also attentive. the only thing i had problems with were the ants in my room i eventually purchased some raid and that did the trick. I spoke to some people that i met and i was the only person that seemed to have a problem with them! i did not know that this was a gay friendly hotel so i was very surprised when i got to the beach and every man was gay. After the initial shock i made some great friends and was even taken to my first gay club. as a single women i felt very safe and i would definatly travel to this hotel again and again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, Great location at a fraction of cost.”
Reviews.Author: jojo3269
Reviews.Content: I loved this place. I was a little nervous at first for an amazing location at a great price but when I got there Eddie the manager made us feel right at home. Sure our room was a little small compared to The Marriott ( two hotels down) but it was very nice and clean. The central location to everything in the Condado area was great, we could walk to everywhere easily. We were spending 5 days before we went on a cruise I had a 10yr old with me and we spent almost everyday on the beach directly in front of the hotel. This beach is shared with the Concha ($600 a night) and the Marriott San Juan. I would have to say that the staff and the management made this place very special to us. Over friendly always offering to help in any way. We are already planning our visit back. Eddie your the best and thank you so very much. Joanne and Rosie from Minnesota

Reviews.Title: “City of”
Reviews.Author: Guy12398
Reviews.Content: Great locations beatfull beach and people, but this hotel After the new managment, Staffs and management are very unfriendly with the gay people and comunity, with they rules!!! Giving us very anplesure experiences for more the one time for my group and other friends,

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps the worst hotel we've ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: teamfoxcatcher
Reviews.Content: Lobby-as-construction-zone was our first encounter with this hotel, and things went downhill from there. The elevator was dangerous and scary, the rooms were tiny and ugly, and the staff was beyond bad -- clueless, rude, and unhelpful. We feel lucky to have emerged relatively unscathed. Do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Overall it was a good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: sidekickgypsy
Reviews.Content: The location was great. It was right by the beach. I don't understand why it got such bad reviews, although this place is not for the homophobic and the internet wasn't available in the rooms. However, you can use the internet for free in the lobby. The desk was really helpful with locations of restaurants and whatnot. The rooms aren't exactly five star but they were great to sleep in. If I were to do it all over again, I would stay in old san Juan just because the taxis are expensive and that's where all the action is. If you're going for the beach at a good price, this is a great place for if you want to explore the city, I would suggest staying in old San Juan and coming to the beach for a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal and location!”
Reviews.Author: JorgeNChrsitian
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great deal in the heart of Condado... We stayed at this hotel during our last three days in our 2 weeks trip to Puerto Rico. It was a great deal, good price, wonderful beds, it has a very fun deck with wonderful drinks and very helpful bartenders, good front desk service, however, the hotel needs a make over desperately.... I would have not mind pay a bit extra, if owners invest a bit of money in remodeling the building.... The location is simply excellent!!!! the hotel is in front of the beach with a magnific view.... and walking distance from everything...

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a great price”
Reviews.Author: tylerkreider
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a deluxe resort, this is not the place for you. If, however, you're looking for a place to sleep, which is right on a vibrant beach in San Juan, I fully recommend this hotel. The management is very friendly, and the hotel is walkable from nightlife, Old San Juan, and plenty of restaurants. Also, the bar facing the beach opens at 11 AM. Need I say more?

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: NjSusan
Reviews.Content: You get a location, that's it. Hotel is in horrible condition. They have so much potential! We had a lovely view from our room, and though could hear the surf - could also hear other guests and doors slamming through paper thin walls. Bar is gross and dirty looking. Elevator something out of a horror show.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: CBussey64
Reviews.Content: I blindly booked this hotel, read bad reviews, read good reviews, read in between reviews .... and I was happy with Atlantic Beach. Is it a 5 star hotel, NO it is not. The rooms were clean ... and the people on here that complained about sand on the floors it is right off the beach, what do you expect? The room was immaculate and clean, as were the bathrooms. The lady and gentleman at the desk were knowledgeable and very friendly. The guests were nice, and yes it is a mix of straight and gay but I don't care, that isn't why I rent a hotel room. It was steps to the beach and what a beautiful site that was. The ONLY complaint were other people slamming their doors during the night or being loud, but that can happen anywhere .... I would book a room here again. You can't beat the view.

Reviews.Title: “A faded beauty, what a shame.”
Reviews.Author: Selfabsobedsanfran
Reviews.Content: Once a happening bar, it sits on top of San Juan's gay beach. The ocean breeze & the crashing waves don't make up for the over priced drinks & poor attitude. It's okay to be badly in need if a coat of paint but is a toilet bowl brush & bleach that hard to come by? At least clean the bathrooms!

Reviews.Title: “Its amazing that a 3rd world country as we call it can offer a much better experience”
Reviews.Author: msacerio
Reviews.Content: -Hotel is in horrible conditions, I am almost thought they used pictures from another hotel. -Overall plumbing very very poor condition. -Service? NONE! (room service may i get some towels? Yes! you can come down and get them yourself) -Elevator does not work -Mold and Mildew all around (smells everywhere) -Not accommodating if you rent car -You have to give a deposit for EVERYTHING -Over priced (base their prices on location)

Reviews.Title: “Vacation”
Reviews.Author: sasiris
Reviews.Content: not what expect it. bed was very comfortable but other than that....did not like it at all...

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, great spot”
Reviews.Author: PoetMother
Reviews.Content: The Atlantic Beach Hotel is in a great location, has a wonderful beach, and is very affordable. If you are a contemporary traveler looking for a reasonable small spot that is just a few miles from the San Juan airport, this will serve you well. It isn't fancy, but some people prefer a personal slant over generic trimmings.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain hotel--clean room with no amenities”
Reviews.Author: CWH202
Reviews.Content: Overall, I thought the hotel was worth the money. It is in the same neighborhood as the big resorts in Condado and is right on the beach. The room I stayed in appeared to be newly renovated and was very clean. The room was simple--a bed, a desk, a tv, and a bathroom. There are really no amenities at this hotel. Go for a cheap, clean room in a great location. Do not stay here if you are looking for a pool, gym, restaurant, etc. The hotel does have a bar, but it was closed for most of my stay. The hotel advertises WIFI, but it does not work in the rooms. You have to sit in the lobby to get online.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Time”
Reviews.Author: ncstu1946
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at the Atlantic Beach Hotel in Conando Beach. If you're looking for a 5-star hotel with all the whistles and bells then this one isn't for you. If, however, you want a hotel with a very friendly staff that's right on the beach with very good rates then this hotel is for you. The hotel was in the process of rennovation but it was not intrusive to our stay in either mess or noise. The guest rooms have been redone since we were there last and though a bit small are comfortable and plesant. The new paint, marble floors and redone bathrooms are very nice. The staff went out of their way to accomodate any request we had while there. We definitely would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BJW2010
Reviews.Content: We arrived from this hotel from the airport around eleven and had to pay $16 for a taxi. When we arrived the front desk was not manned. We waited a few minutes for the clerk. It was late and storming so we didnt go outside but there seemed to be a nice pool area and it was directly on the ocean. We checked in and even though we had payed in advance we had to give them a credit card so they could hold $100 in case we made damage. The room was very nice. It was clean, it was nicely decorated, and we had a picture perfect view of the ocean. The only problem: no air conditioning. It was storming outside so if we opened the window we got the bed and nightstands wet. It was not a very good sleep because we were very hot. Around 4am we decided we were thirsty. There are no vending machines so we had to walk to the walgreens up the street, which wasnt very far. Overall I had a fairly good experience. We checked out the next morning and even though they said we were not being charged for any room damage. They hold didnt come off my bank account for three days.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming,”
Reviews.Author: iangelous
Reviews.Content: hotel doesnt have that many amenities its a place where you can just stay to sleep shower and change they do have a bar down stairs and the beach view is incredible but thats just about it..... They recently remodeled the location and its looking fantastic..

Reviews.Title: “great location.”
Reviews.Author: hkboxer
Reviews.Content: We skipped a city in PR so had one night with out reservation. Booked one night in this hotel. The beach bar (gay) had some traffic during sun set but that was the only time I saw it with people. The bartenders were nice but the place needs a little bit of tlc. The bar area was not so inviting but the view was nice. There is a beach in front of the hotel and there are free beach chairs for guests to use. It was quiet and gay part of the beach is next to the hotel where some locals and visitors lay out. A guy rents out beach chair for 3 dollars. Most of the public area in the hotel needs some updating but it is clean. The room we stayed in was simple but nice, clean and newly renovated and had a view of the ocean. Our over all stay was ok. The only thing that might be a problem to others is you can not have visitors in your room. It is the hotel policy. Basically if you plan to entertain, you might have to consider other accommodation options. But if that is not an issue, the place is clean and very convenient to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: greensharpie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last week of October. We chose the hotel because of it's location on the beach and not far from old san juan. We were looking for a hotel that was nicely priced and a good place to sleep at night , because we were out for most of the day..it was perfect for that. The people at the desk of the hotel were very friendly and we had fresh towels and a clean room each day. Did not have any problems. They even drug out the beach chairs for us when we went down to the beach. The water is very rough though, so we didn't swim, but the beach was pretty nice. Reading some of the other reviews, we knew there would be some gay people around, but it didn't bother us one bit, everyone was super nice and we had no issues at all. The hotel is right around the corner from the bus stop- warning, it is almost impossible to find a bus map! But we waited about 15 mins for the bus (costs 75 cents)to go into san juan and while in san juan we visited the forts by walking and the free trolley. The issue was trying to get back to condado by bus, waited nearly an hour for one at the depot..so it may be best to take a taxi back, which will run you 10-15 dollars. There is a dunkin donuts right down the street, a wendys and an excellent eating place called "angels puerto rican food" delicious! we stayed for about 4 days... a wed thru sunday..never had any issues with the loudness of the bar at night, you can only hear the ocean, we stayed on the third floor, ocean view. only complaint- dont stay there if you plan to watch tv alot- the tv was very old and no remote, but we weren't there for tv : ) so this is a great deal if you just need a place to sleep, if you are looking to stay in your hotel room all day, you might want to choose a fancier hotel : )

Reviews.Title: “It's Not the Four Seasons, but it's cheap, clean, and right on the ocean.”
Reviews.Author: kcshoegurl
Reviews.Content: Seriously, you will not be living a life of luxury at this hotel. And yes, the hotel is run down but it does have its charms. (That being the hotel staff, and the beach front bar... just make sure to hit them up at happy hour (4-7pm) for the $3 drinks.) The rooms are pretty small, but clean. Just make sure to either bring clothes that will not wrinkle , or a travel iron/steamer, as there are no irons in the room.. you have to use the community iron upstairs in the "penthouse" , which is the worlds oldest and smallest iron. And, prepare yourself for very little closet/drawer space. BUT! The beds are super comfortable, so it has that going for it. While the hotel does provide beach chairs, they do not provide beach towels (although I did hear you can rent them) so make sure to bring your own. Mark works the front desk at night and is awesome. He can tell you where all the hotspots are ,and give you some tricks and tips on how to get there. FYI .. you can totally barter with the cab drivers. It took us 3 days to figure that out. There are "businessmen" that hang out around the hotel, but at no time did I ever feel unsafe. They pretty much just kept to themselves. Also, if you decide to stay here prepare yourself for the condition of the building next door to the hotel. All in all our stay at the Atlantic Beach was good. Its a small little shell of what it used to be (apparently back in the day it used to be the place to go in San Juan...), and it looks like they are trying to renovate when and where they can.. just prepare yourself .. they have a ways to go. Oh, and avoid the elevator. Yikes.

Reviews.Title: “A Horrible Nightmare - I'm A Hotel Manager!”
Reviews.Author: HotelManager411
Reviews.Content: I had booked a 6 day stay at this location, I understand that in life you get what you pay for but this place really killed it... not only do they not have individual A/C in the rooms, but the Central AC system they have sucks, my baggage was opened and left open while I was out of the hotel, they treat the guest at hotel as if you were trash, at least the tall older security man does, parking is dreadful, even if your going up to your room for 5 minutes, you need to go inside, get the front desk agent to open the garage and then come back out to get it... it gets to a point were they are bothered to assist you.. the hotel WiFi does not reach the rooms, and your are not allowed to bring anyone to your room, if they are not on the list, regardless if its your son, sister, brother or boyfriend it is not acceptable... overall the price is great, but when you stay there you will see why, I know this hotel was once a magnificent place filled with nightlife, now you simply have rude people working there, one night I came in with my boyfriend from the other side of the island and my boyfriend forgot his wallet, the security officer would not let us or at least him back in the room, regardless of the paperwork and regardless of his name being on the registration card.. Please Book A Night Here So You Can Also Share Your Story Of Terror

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price.”
Reviews.Author: JTNY1
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location right on the Cordado Beach. Very nice, responsive and knowledgeable staff. The room we occupied(308) was updated and clean. The room was small but I didn't stay in the room much only to sleep a few hours lol. The bar area was great, over looking the beach and let me not forget the roof top deck. Great views of the beach and surrounding areas. This hotel is close to and within walking distance to shops, restaurants and casino's for those who like to gamble. I would recommend this hotel but make sure you request a renovated room with a private bathroom. Some of there room come with shared baths. And yes I will stay at this establishment again.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest location on Condado Beach”
Reviews.Author: enb4peace
Reviews.Content: There is no doubt that this building needs a serious update, but if you can get past that. it has so many nice things about it.The staff, Nancy, Mark,Ivan,Louis, the gentleman who recommended Angels place to eat,are all so pleasant and accommodating.The rooms is small but clean.Sitting on the Patio Bar with the views and the trade winds is like being in paradise~I would go back again.The people of Puerto Rico are lovely and the sound of the Coqui is still ringing in our ears!~Thank you all!~Eileen and Peter Butler Mass.

Reviews.Title: “sweet little hotel”
Reviews.Author: luna1122
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend and i travelled to puerto rico for a few days on vieques, and the rest back in san juan. we'd found the site of the atlantic beach hotel, liked the look of it, and the price. we're a hetero couple but this being a 'gay hotel' didn't factor in one way or another...why would it? we'd read some of the negative reviews so were a tiny bit doubtful about it, but we really enjoyed it. sure, it's a little shabby. the elevator is sloooow and creaky. the phone situation is a little odd. (we'd accidentally drowned our phones while in vieuqes,so had to rely on landlines) but our room was squeaky clean, newly refurbished, all white and stark and minimalistic and pretty, the closet was roomy, the bathroom cute, the water pressure just fine, and the AC...well, it can't BE too cold for me, so i had no problem with it. best of all: the view. we opened our drapes and beheld sparkling blue/green waters and gently waving palm trees and white sand, just steps outside our door. the staff was universally pleasant and helpful, from the front desk to the bartenders, the drinks good, the beach chairs and towels free. we slept like babies with the sound of the surf lulling us. the neighborhood seems FINE to me, lively and busy, with tons of restaurants and shopping nearby, and we never felt unsafe. i'd definitely recommend this to open minded, laid back folks who just want a clean pretty room on the beach at a good price, and don't need frills or pampering. we'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: Adrianacro1
Reviews.Content: I not gay, so I was very skeptical about this place. I can tell that is not the Hilton but for the price and the service, my money was very well spent. The view was gorgeous, you feel in heaven. My room was always clean, the bathroom is not a spa salon but it is very decent, hot water always available. The Bar in really nice, Ivan was our bartender and he is divine. Angel was our guy in the front desk, and meanwhile my friends were having fun with their gay partners he took the time to talk and spent quality time with me even that he is gay, and that is what I call service. The restaurants near by are really good and cheap. Everything is close, no more than 10 minuts away. And the hotel also offered different tours around the city and were GREAT. For sure I'll do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Former Gay Hotel goes Hetero, but beach is still gay--go figure?”
Reviews.Author: jaonyc
Reviews.Content: In the past this was the Premiere Gay Hotel in Condado with a large roof top club and exclusively gay clientele. Thus, the beach in front of the hotel was gay. The hotel has changed ownership and it is now marketed as a "Gay Friendly " hotel. Gone is the roof top club, the bar is pretty pathetic and in are the weekend strollers with families and kids...in a words "NOT FUN". The good news is that the rooms have been renovated, but the a/c is not individually controlled in your room (which may account for the large openning on the bottom of each room door for more ventilation). If you pay your bar tab with a credit card be prepared to pay an additional fee of 15% (illegal...hmmm, and no waiter tips on credit card). Some small details that need to be looked at, turn onthe water so you can rinse your feet when you leave beach, otherwise there is sand all over lobby and in your room. Huge exclusively gay hotel under construction across street that will probably bring Atlantic Beach to it's knees. Best to spend your money elsewhere and visit the unHappyHour as a guest.--bar staff are fun and worth chatting with.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel and I will stay there in the future”
Reviews.Author: mikah526
Reviews.Content: Not only was it a nice hotel and a good price but the employees were so nice and welcoming, Just to name a few Ivan, Angel, Tino, Armando, All were so nice, Our rooms were clean the whole time, The hotel was right on the beach, its beyond gay friendly, There were nice places to eat as well but we found one right across the street from the gym next to the hotel called Orosco's so we eat there everyday, The clubs are like a 5 min cab ride away, The weather was so nice the whole time, and yes there were some men that stand around waiting for someone to pay them to "hang out" but that's just how it is there we assumed... : ) But but yes if you want to stay at a nice hotel that is right on the beach Atlantic Beach Hotel is it!

Reviews.Title: “What a bargain!”
Reviews.Author: vero600
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoyed my stay at the Atlantic Beach Hotel -- it was clean and comfortable, and it's a shame that it gets so many negative reviews. Perhaps I can clear a few things up. This IS a gay-friendly hotel. The crowd is a comfortable mix of gay and straight people, and the service is fine regardless of sex and gender. Homophobes, stay away, please. As for the comments accusing the staff of bias, I can only assume it has something to do with the fact that there are a lot of gay prostitutes who hang around the hotel, trying to get invited in, and frankly, I wouldn't want to let them in, either. This IS a no frills, budget hotel, and it's a good deal. At this price, if you expect luxury you're setting yourself up for disappointment. I was happy with my room, though the shower dripped and the A/C was a bit too cold (I just opened the window to let some warm air in). The view from my window was worth way more than I paid. In the future, if I go for a romantic vacation, I'll probably stay somewhere nicer and more expensive, but for a quick, cheap weekend on the beach, this is the perfect hotel. The location, on Condado beach, is within a popular tourist area with lots of hotels and restaurants. Oh, and it's ON THE BEACH. Sure, it's on a side street rather than the main road, but it's not exactly off the beaten path and it's not a particularly dangerous area. As I mentioned above, there are some shady characters who hang out outside the hotel, but if you don't mess with them, they don't mess with you. One thing I really loved about this hotel is the bar. The bartenders are super friendly and the beach view is outstanding. It's a really great place to just sit and chat and have a drink without having to get all dressed up and pay a cover. Also, the hotel provides beach chairs and umbrellas to guests, which makes a perfect spot for drinking pina coladas and enjoying the eye candy. I recommend this hotel to anyone with an open mind who wants to visit San Juan on a budget. It's a great deal, and I had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT waste your money!! Bed bugs and rude staff!”
Reviews.Author: Bruin98
Reviews.Content: I just finished a week's stay at the Atlantic Beach Hotel with a friend and by the last day we couldn't wait to get out of there!! We had booked this place for the following reasons: #1: it's advertised as a "gay-friendly" hotel in many sites and gay travel publications, #2: the llocation, right in the center of Condado, #3: the price. To be as objective and real as I can be, I will list the good first: 1. Location: its true, it is righ in fron of what's considered the "gay beach" and at the center of all restaurants and shops, but then again, so are the other hotels AND you can still come to the gay beach for free because beaches are all public here. 2. Price: when you are on a budget and not a "picky" traveler, all you want is a clean place to sleep and bathe. By the look of the tiles in the bathroom and the furniture in the room you can tell they have done some remodeling. The BAD: where do I even begin?? 1. The staff: when we checked in, no explanation was given to us of what was around or nearby. Also there is one guy we named the "hotel nazi" because he keeps an eye on your every move; VERY uncomfortable. Yes, I know I'm gay, I don't need you to keep staring at me like I'm going to start an orgy or something. 2. The rest of the hotel is in serious need of a remodel: the bar is rund down, the elevator seems like it's about to give any minute (very scary!), and the front deskreminds me of a disorganized private investigator's desk from a bad 80's police show: paperwork pinned on boards and stacked all over. There's also a lingering smell of damp rags in that area. I know we are near the beach and all, but really? This is my first impression? 3. BED BUGS!! Every morning i'd wake up with itchy tiny rashes which I thought were due to mosquitoes. Then it ocurred to me to look at my sheets one day, and sure enough, there they were!! Yuck!! Do I needto go on?? 4. Heavy Atmosphere. I've stayed at plenty budget hotels before where I have felt like I've stayed at a 5 star resort because of the friendliness of the staff. Here I felt like I was in a dorm where my every move had to be analyzed in case I became a sex-crazed, out-of-control gay man! Seriously?? Even the locals would agree this is NOT the place to stay if you are a gay client simply because its in front of the gay beach or it has a "gay-friendly" bar. I learned my lesson. Next time I will spend a few more dollars and stay somewhere else!! In the mean time, I'm putting the word out there. If you are gay, STAY AWAY!! Use the gay beach during the day if you'd like, but then go to a nicer place to sleep at night where you are not treated like a prisoner!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value”
Reviews.Author: PRalltheway
Reviews.Content: So really, what did you all expect for a hotel located directly on the ocean for $89.00? Nope, not the Ritz, but a really pleasant little hotel. For that price I received a clean comfortable room with an ocean view, and a very accommodating staff. I am really puzzled by all of the negative reviews here. The location couldn't be any better and there was never a time that I felt "unsafe". I own a small hotel in PR and I can confidently reccommend The Atlantic Beach Hotel for my guests traveling to Condado. We'll be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “One night stay”
Reviews.Author: LauraVioleta
Reviews.Content: I'm puertorican and live in san juan. Wanted just a one night room in the least expensive htl near the Vista al Mar area, where a fiesta was to take place all afternoon and evening. After reading reviews and checking prices I gambled on the Atlantic Beach. The Condado area of san juan is quite expensive. My bill came to $108 including an oceanfront room, one night parking and taxes. I found friendly staff. The building still needs more care. It is an old building and in front of the ocean it depreciates quickly. I found my refurbished room clean and very pretty. The new bed and white bedding were beautiful and very comfortable. Sparkling room floor and small bathroom were clean and very pretty. Room size just right. Funny that you cannot control the air conditioning, but it was ok (this was in july). Room on the second floor so I went up and down the refurbished stairs, bright and nice. The elevator needs a remake but it works. Oceanfront bar simple, comfy and friendly. Patrons low key, friendly and happy. The ocean in that area is somewhat too rough for me, I perfer calmer waters but still lots of adults and children were bathing. I found the area not dangerous but one must always be careful. I was not approached by anybody for anything and didn't see anybody like waiting for us as we went in and out of the htl. All that said...there is a new building going up across Vendig St. in front of the htl and nextdoors facing the ocean there is an abandoned see through shell of a same size and type building as the Atlantic Beach. Walking distance with entrance right on Ashford Ave. and sharing the same beach are the Renaissance La Concha and the Marriott plus other. The Atlantic Beach entrance, which is on Vendig St. could use a gardener and a painter. Can't figure why it's not been done. Conclusion: wish the owners would pay more attention to the front area. I'd go back if need be and would recommend with aforementioned flags. I'm posting some photos.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT Stay Here if you want to be in a NICE area”
Reviews.Author: CaraF_20
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent put me and my husband here on our honeymoon. We were scheduled for three nights, but stayed one and went looking for a better, safer place. The only good thing was the hotel had a nice view of the ocean. We had trouble finding the place because it is basically at the end of an alley and has only four parking spots (behind gates). It is an old, renovated building that has not been cared for well. The hallways are dark and dirty, the elevator does not work properly, and we felt unsafe in the general area. The room was alright, except it didn't have air control in the room and the door didn't fit properly so a lot of light came in from the hallway. The bathroom was basically a closet you had to step a foot into, and the shower was tiny. We decided to go elsewhere after walking to a nearby Dunkin Donuts for breakfast - the doors were locked, the staff had to allow you to come in. The general area felt very unsafe. We went to Old San Juan, which was much better, and stayed at The Gallery Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great time. Renovated rooms beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: manamystery
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my third stay at Atlantic Beach Hotel and it was great. The newly renovated rooms were great and looked like something out of the West Elm Catalog. Rooms were clean and service daily was great. Jack and the rest of the front desk staff were very friendly and accommodating, night and day. Armando the bartender was terrific and having the beach at the bottom of the steps was awesome. No, it's not the Ritz Carlton but more intimate with character and the ocean views are great. Will definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Very inexpensive but you get what you pay for at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Keith5186
Reviews.Content: Old hotel that has been remodeled. Elevator was not working properly, hallways were filthy, rooms very small, sand on the bed sheets before we even sat on the bed. If that was not bad enough, there is no temperature control in the rooms. It was 95 degrees outside and 50 degrees in our room. When we complained about how cold the room was, the staff told us to try to close the vents because the entire hotel is the same temperature. The vents were not able to close so we froze for 2 nights. The hotel is positioned at the end of a very small street that appears to be an alley at first sight. This place has absolutely NO curb appeal. The hotel is also flanked by 2 abandoned hotels that are mere shells. Everytime we left the hotel there were always several men positioned on the street asking us if we wanted "help" with anything. The beach was nice but the staff told us not to carry anything valuable with us on the beach once it got dark. The outdoor bar was about the only redeeming part of this property. We expected SO much more since the hotel boasts its "gay friendly" status. We planned on staying longer but had to leave after 2 nights and stay at another hotel down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Do not Stay there.. This is not a Hotel this a Cheap Motel”
Reviews.Author: datadee2000
Reviews.Content: I arrived on May 18th I didn't like the view the front of the hotel that is.. I gave it a chance..got to my room and was disgusted by what I saw.. the room was very old the door only had one lock it appeared that someone broke in there. I'm a single woman and ran out of there. I stayed at the Radissun a few blocks away more expensive but it was worth my peace of mind and safety--beware it looks like criminals go there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: tcotto
Reviews.Content: I was a bit apprensive about booking this hotel based on some of the complainers here on tripadvisor. However, my wife and I took a chance and bit the bullet. We could not have been more pleased with our stay and the way we were warmly treated by the staff. The rooms were quite nice for a small hotel and the location could not have been better. The maids were very nice and left our rooms very clean and they always left extra towels each day in our room after our first request. As my wife and I are quite open minded to other lifestyles, we found that the few gay persons that we encountered in the bar area were very polite and seemed more on the professional side. Overall we will definately return to the Atlantic Beach Hotel and highly recommend it to our friends who might be passing thru San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “For one night, it was what we needed.”
Reviews.Author: kejannic0206
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Atlantic Beach Hotel the night before leaving for a cruise out of San Juan. For us, it was what we needed for a one night stay. We got a good deal on this hotel which is why we chose to stay here. The rooms were OK. Small but clean. The elevator is a little sketchy. I got a little nervous going in it! I wanted to lay on the beach in the morning but they didn't have any chairs out. I was a little bummed about that. I would never stay here for a whole week, but if like us, you are looking for a place to spend a night or two, for the price it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, good value”
Reviews.Author: KSUboy
Reviews.Content: We came to this hotel wanting 1) a place on the beach, and 2) a place to sleep. This was a very clean (we had room 205, a remodeled room with a great ocean view) room that served that function well. No frills (breakfast, pool, etc.) but we weren't there to hang out in the room. Room was very clean, staff was very friendly and helpful. the only issue (which wasn't that bad) was that we were right above the bar. The music was usually drowned out by the sounds of the ocean, but once in a while, a song was played that was a little too loud (when I'm staying in an ocean view room, I'd much rather hear the waves than Cher). Great location within walking distance of a great local market, old San Juan, and a ton of other sites. Be sure to ask for Rupert if you want a rainforest tour. Great stay, and we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “LISTEN TO ME---DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: pichulita2
Reviews.Content: As many of the other reviews... we saw a mixed review from really good to really bad... and unfortunately for us... it was the really BAD!!! It is VERY much a Gay oriented hotel... which is not a big deal if you dont mind the crowd..but a HUGE deal if the staff members are not polite, and nice to you if you are not a 6 foot atletic man! ( we were 2 females) The bar and view was nice, but the beach service clased awful early and you could not take towels to seat on their beach chairs. They would not allow to check in before 3 even though they were rooms available.... Another issue is that there were no towels in the room and they would bring us the towels. we had to go get them ourselves. Also their laundry fascility is a dump and their iron stainned my beautiful whiite blouse with rusty water that came out of the chainned to the wall ironning board and iron.... they did nothing about this, and only told me that they had no idea that there was no light and that the iron was bad since they bnever go up there... BIG Flag... Anyways... I am big on using reviews and I have to tell you that this place is just as it sounds... A HUGE lottery... you may get luck and not have problems, or you will hate your stay... I am not going back EVER!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value!”
Reviews.Author: NikkiZiv
Reviews.Content: We traveled to San Juan to attend a destination wedding. Neither one of us has ever been to San Juan. We stayed for a week and was looking forward to exploring the area. The staff was very nice and gave us good tips on where to dine and gave us great directions to get around. The room was small, clean, light and airy. The bed was comfy as well. The location was great and within walking distance of many good restaurants. The hotel is remodeling so there is some old mixed with new which we didn't mind. This hotel is good if you like to explore the area you are staying in. If you want to lounge around the pool or beach and be waited on hand and foot then you need to spend more money and stay at big overpriced resort. There is a $50 deposit fee that they require upon check in. They give you a receipt and you return the receipt and they give you the $50 back. I was not aware of this prior to checking in but was ok with it when they explained that it will be returned at the time of check out (which we did receive). The two things I would liked to have had was an vending machine with snacks (there is a Walgreens one block from the hotel) for convenience, ice machine and a coffee machine (in the room). If there was an ice machine, we never found it. The hotel and surrounding area is safe. We had walked back from many restaurants and bars at 11:30 p.m. or later and felt safe. The only time I was truly annoyed was the second night we were there the Billboard Latin Music Awards was taking place and the Conrad Hilton and La Concha were hosting after parties. At 3:45 a.m., La Concha taught it would be a good idea to set off a professional firework display on the beach a couple of properties down from the Atlantic Beach Hotel to close the party. It sounded like the City was under attack. That is not the Atlantic's fault, just make sure you're not staying when the music awards is happening :) To sum this hotel up: Pros: Great price, great location, clean and helpful staff Cons: No pool (for those that don't like sand between their toes), no vending machine, ice machine, no in room coffee maker

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for those who don't require sleep!”
Reviews.Author: BillyBoy1230
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 nights stay at the Atlantic Beach. Rooms are freshly painted and clean. Basic accommodations with huge flat screen HDTV. Bathrooms are spotless and the beds are comfortable. Location is top notch! Right on the beach and is a gay friendly hotel with a beach bar. Lounge beach chairs and umbrellas provided free of charge to hotel guest. The biggest draw back is that all night long you hear people coming in all hours of the night and slamming their door. Loud talking in the hallway that just echos through out. If you don't require much sleep then this is the perfect location for the price that can't be beat. Staff is friendly and the beach is wonderful. Can be quit cruisey too. Especially on the weekends. Hustlers are out and about day and night so beware.

Reviews.Title: “Not Gay Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Harquer
Reviews.Content: If You're Gay Don't Give Them Your Business! This place is listed on several gay travel sites as being gay-owned/gay-friendly, though it was apparently sold a few years, it continues to misrepresent itself to gay travelers. The management is anything but gay friendly: they monitor guest's visitors and forcefully prohibit any they don't like, even if well behaved. My guest was asked to leave apparently just because he was the same sex and was in my paid-in-advance room and even though no loud or nuisance behavior was afoot. They also asked me, the guest, to leave -- then tried charging me for that very night! While part of this can be attributed to the tourist-trap milieu of San Jan generally, I definitely felt hostile discrimination. The hotel itself is located right on the beach, but that's the only redeeming characteristic. Yes, they provide courtesy beach chairs, but renting a beach towel costs $10! Yes, they have a bar, but if you want something more than a bottle of beer or rum&coke, forget it. Interior is very basic with tile flooring, which being on the beach might be understandable for cleaning purposes, but there was always sand even in the room! The bathroom has shower only and only half-sized sink. And no thermostat nor any individual climate control. I'm used to bare-bones travel including other parts of Latin America, but this was the worst value and least hospitable travel in my LA experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget priced hotel with some renovated rooms, right on the beach.”
Reviews.Author: fabreps
Reviews.Content: Make sure you get a renovated room as they are quite nice, but small. The showers are among the best ever! The beds are comfortable. The staff were very friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Beach front, friendly staff, perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: megleebak
Reviews.Content: I went down with 2 girlfriends and we had such a fantastic time. The staff was super friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable however we did wish for temperature control at night because the AC was on too high. If your intent is to spend the majority of your time on the beach this place is perfect. You walk down the back steps directly on to the beach where they provide chairs and umbrellas free of charge. We spent a lot of time at the beach front bar sipping on reasonably priced drinks and talking with the locals and other hotel patrons. The whole place has a very good friendly vibe. If I return to PR I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very adequate place to stay...great location!”
Reviews.Author: MichelleN4
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights here after "roughing it" in Old San Juan for four nights. It's right in the middle of all the big hotels on Ashford Avenue and restaurants/shopping/Walgreens was not too far away. It is smack dab on the beach and the people at the front desk were very helpful and friendly. I asked for, and received a renovated room (see pictures) and it was a very comfortable place to sleep. I did have an issue with the maid not replacing the towels she took and I was afraid it was going to be an issue when I checked out at 6am...but it was not. That being said, it didn't have a lot of ambiance. The bar downstairs played the WORST music-I'm talking Britney Spears/MTV stuff and I would have preferred some salsa...especially since I was in PR. The music alone kept me from hanging out at the bar. As other reviewers mentioned, it is ground zero for Condado gay beach culture and I would have preferred not to see young, gay Puerto Rican men "cruising" the strip looking for love/cash. There is an abandoned building right next door and evidently things get steamy on the beach next door after hours. I don't write this to scare anyone away...as it wasn't a safety issue and as a female traveling alone I didn't feel unsafe, just know what's going on around you. I met a local, very friendly drug dealer right outside the hotel as well, too bad I'm not into drugs. I won't likely stay here again, though this has less to do with the hotel and more to do with the area. It didn't have the character that Old San Juan did...depends on what you're looking for. There wasn't enough opportunity for people watching or going out for this solo traveler, but it should suit couples/families just fine!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Quiet, Convenient and Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: BklynMJ
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel with three friends for a short term stay of 3 nights/4 days. The hotel was right on the beach, quiet, and conveniently located amongst tons of cute restaurants and boutiques in Condado. They offered on beach bar service, chairs/umbrellas etc, free internet access (that was spotty on a few of the days) and a friendly/helpful/flexible staff. Although they didn't have a workout room, there was a fitness center right at the end of the street that offered 15 dollar day passes. The hotels on either side were no longer in use and there was construction going on down the street, but it was not noisy and it appeared that everywhere in Condado construction was going on anyway. There was also a convenient local bus route right along the outer road that took us to Old San Juan in around 20 minutes. If you want american style breakfast you may have to head to one of the american chains, but if you're adventurous you can also piece together a breakfast from the closeby grocery store. lastly, as a vegetarian I was nervous that the restaurants in the area would not have options for me, but they did and were very accomodating to a party that included a vegetarian(myself) someone with a nut allergy and someone with an allergy to whitefish!

Reviews.Title: “Living on its past”
Reviews.Author: DrBStL
Reviews.Content: The Atlantic Beach Hotel at one point was probably a gay hot spot for a cheap, no frills hotel on the beach, conveniently located to restaurants and the bus line. Unfortunately, like so many successful gay bars and establishments, the owners pocket the profits and put off any improvements as long as possible. This hotel is now in the process of renovating the rooms and their apartment building, where i stayed. The desk staff was helpful and courteous. The renovation is superficial. One of my rooms had a contemporary new bed and attractive bedspread, but the other rooms looked like leftovers from the 60s in a floral pattern. The water pressure was terrible. Takes a long time for hot water to get to the third floor.They put in a new granite counter tops, but didn't have it sealed and any moisture at all left big spots until it evaporated. Wait until someone spills some wine or suntan oil and it will be there forever. The exterior of the hotel is chipping off. The Wi Fi only works in the lobby. None is available even for pay in the room. The bar is boring. The beach during the week (high season at the end of February) never had more than 15 people, and on the weekend had only 25: and most on the weekend were not gay. It's ok if you are on a low budget, but there are better places to stay if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Butterflyclub
Reviews.Content: This Condado Beach Hotel was loaded with warm hospitality. The staff was excellent in making this solo traveler feel welcome. The staff was so friendly and willing to answer all my questions, such as giving me directions to cultural events and sightseeing. From this area it was easy to catch buses to Old San Juan, the art museums and many other places of interest. The room was very comfortable and the housekeeing staff did a wonderful job of refreshing my room daily without inconvenience. It really was the perfect location to spend time on the beach. It was also located near the tourist area where you could walk to several nice restaurants and plenty of shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing like the photos!”
Reviews.Author: casscris
Reviews.Content: When we first drove up I was a little put off by all the graffiti on the buildings. My husband and I both thought the hotel looked a little run down and dirty. The lobby was very old looking. We arrived early as we just got off of the cruise ship. We had A LOT of luggage including valuable souvenirs we had purchased as well as a laptop computer. We were told our room would not be ready til around 3 - which was completely understandable. The gentleman told us they would hold our luggage and put tags on it. We were grateful. My husband helped him move our things into a back room which did not seem very secure. So my husband asked "is our stuff safe here" to which the man replied "if not you can take it with you!" We were just looking for a little reassurance! He could have just assured us that it was secure! Rude! The elevator really, really needed to be wiped down! I don't even mind so much how old it was -- it was dirty and it smelled like mildew! The halls upstairs looked ok, I was hopeful and having seen the photos on their website, I just knew our room would be nice -- NOT! The only thing similar to the photos were the white linens and the bathroom looked pretty updated, although the shower looked dirty! I was SO disappointed with the room! The hotel website DID NOT mention that they were in the process of updating -- I certainly would have requested one of those rooms and my review would be MUCH better! Room 301 - The lamp shades were water warped, TV was tiny with no remote, there was no AC control (very hot room, we had to open the door for a while just to get some air circulation from the hallway), towel had questionable stains, table needed to be cleaned. We went to Walgreen's and bought LYSOL! Sprayed everything in the room and the elevator and the doors! We were woken up several times during the night because of the partying going on just below our window in the patio bar but especially because of the LOUD guests in the hallways. This was a very noisy place. You can not swim in the water behind this hotel because there are big rocks, you have to walk down to other hotels and even at that there are signs warning you not to go into the water due to strong current. If you have kids, especially BE AWARE of this -- my husband is a very tall and strong man and the currents pulled him out with ease! As far as the comments I've read about prostitution as well homosexuals; There were a lot of questionable looking men right outside the door but I'm pretty sure that's a public area so I can't necessarily blame the hotel for that, if they were prostitutes even. However we made the decision not to be out at night as I did not feel safe! But during the day we liked it! Shopping was good, restaurants, etc. We figured out that this was a place where gays frequented and at first it was awkward because we're not "urban" people so we're rarely around that. But it didn't bother us at all, everyone seemed to mind their own business! Also the hotel charged us a fifty dollar deposit in addition to the night's rate which they did not tell us about. I didn't like that. The gentleman that worked the desk in the evening hours, older with glasses, used to be in the Navy - he was great, very nice, always smiling told us about the remodeling which made a lot of sense to us! He made sure I was able to connect to the internet with my computer! To the management/owner of the hotel I would like to say to you that instead of always making excuses for the things people did not like at your property, If you would just be forthcoming with things and at least consider making changes and stop blaming your guests for the mistakes, I think it would make your property a lot better. I can tell you that by the time we left, we agreed that we didn't hate it but we definitely would never go back, unfortunately!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, small hotel right on Contado Beach.”
Reviews.Author: dougm_95060
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel after researching for first time to Puerto Rico, and was quite impressed with staff's prompt courteous responses to reviews. Altantic Beach Hotel was exactly as reviewed, and perfect for us: a straight late 50's couple. 2* hotel, with 3 or 4 * ocean view room. No noise at all, only ocean sounds. Although hotel shows its wear and age, especially elevator (which actually works perfectly), staff is in process of renovation, and they are very thoughtful of guests. Yes, it is gay friendly, which I have no problem with, but they are extremely accomodating and welcoming with everyone we saw. There are many great small restaurants close by, as well as Walgreens, casinos, gym, etc, and bus line to Old San Juan. The staff quickly sets up beach chairs and umbrellas right on sand for guests, and beach waiter brings drinks from the bar. As far as negative complaints I've read, I saw no rudeness from any of the staff. Criticism of the weather or waves too big are pointless. Atlantic Beach Hotel feels like a European 2 * hotel or Mexican, all of which we prefer to bland mega-hotels with their rude tip-hungry staffs.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning location, great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: StMawganE14
Reviews.Content: We booked a two night stay at the beginning of a vacation from Europe to Sint Maarten. After a long flight from Madrid we wanted to get to the room and then go for dinner. Check-in was handled efficiently but without much of a warm welcome. The ocean front room was in good order with a reasonable sized bathroom which was clean and well kept. This hotel wins on location and value for money. Beachfront in Condado for this price cannot be beaten. The hotel needs refurbishment (this is obviously happening on the 2nd floor) but the elevator, reception and front of the hotel could all do with a careful makeover. Over our couple of days we used the hotel bar on a number of occasions and found the staff and the atmosphere friendly and welcoming. We will definitley return when next in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest budget place on the beach”
Reviews.Author: TexasSanantonian
Reviews.Content: O;K. this will be a strange review because we did not stay there. As first time visitors to S.J. we stayed in town , not knowing the facts about the beach. We were surprised to find that Condado is a wall of condos and hotels and that access is limited. We rejected the public entry because of limited facilities and were so delighted to find the Atlantic Beach where we "shot it straight" that we needed to rent chairs and an umbrella, use a restroom other than the ocean, and wanted access to a bar.. They could not have been friendlier nor more accommodating. We went there for 5 days and were treated as well as guests. Although this place is reviewed as "gay friendly" we just found it completely friendly and would recommend the hotel to anyone on a tight budget My wife and I will definitely consider it for a future stay .

Reviews.Title: “Great location â€“ Friendly Staff â€“ Good Value.”
Reviews.Author: GumbyPTC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not new, and it is not a full service luxury hotel. We were on a floor that is not yet refurbished, and the furniture was well used but in good condition. With that said, we stayed in a hotel on a prime beachfront location with a beautiful ocean view for 1/3 to 1/4 the price of other beachfront hotels in the area. So, of course, you must have realistic expectations. The hotel is in close walking distance to countless restaurants, bars, casinos, and shops. The staff was friendly and professional. They were attentive and catered to our needs from check-in to housekeeping to the beach and bar staff. A beach attendant set up loungers and beach umbrellas upon request - all provided at no extra charge. He also made runs to the hotel bar. The rooms were basic but very clean. I spend roughly 5 months a year in hotels for business. This is the first time my bed spread/comforter was changed with the bed linens. The mattresses were comfortable and appeared to be new. The only complaint that I have is that the hallway is noisy and you hear other guests coming and going. If you have discourteous guests in the hall at night, it is really loud. My wife, college age daughter, and I had a pleasant stay and will return.

Reviews.Title: “European-style simple hotel with amazing location”
Reviews.Author: MarkOakland
Reviews.Content: We did a tour of the island staying at various places from large resorts to small independent hotels. This was one of our favorite locations. We planned to stay at the Atlantic Beach at the beginning and end of our stay but due to problems with storms on the East Coast, we had to cancel our initial reservations at the Atlantic Beach. Because we did so within their deadline (two days in advance) and in writing (by email), they were fine with accommodating our change in plans. So finally we only stayed there two nights. It would have been easy to stay longer at such a great location. The good: Our ocean-view room felt like it was in the surf. AMAZING. The first night we left our windows open at first, and I realized I would never sleep, the roar of the ocean was so loud. But when we closed the windows, the ocean sound was perfect. The building has central AC so closing the windows wasn't a problem. The rooms are small but clean, the bathrooms likewise ( though with good-sized showers - no tub). The not-so-good: Our room was next to the stairs so I was awakened by doors opening and closing and a few people talking loudly. One thing the hotel could fix would be the 1st-floor door which tends to slam. The door on our floor had a hydraulic closer to keep it quiet, hooray . The beds were fine but a little short for 6'1" me. The elevator is old and rather loud too. If you are driving, parking is a little challenging, though the hotel helps you to work it out. We didn't use our car much because we weren't sure there'd be a spot for us when we returned - though there are parking garages nearby. The beach: The hotel provides beach chairs with an attendant so you can leave your stuff and go play in the surf. In February, the surt was pretty intense with a significant undertow and cross-currents. I had a lot of fun swimming in it but still had a couple of disoriented moments. My partner isn't a strong swimmer so I was glad that he mostly wanted to sunbathe. I found a couple of buddies to swim with so that somebody was paying attention if I ran into trouble. If I had kids, I wouldn't let them in the water, at least not at this time of year. When you come up stairs from the beach to the terrace bar, there is a place to rinse your feet, but it would be nice to have a shower there as well. The bar: We're a gay couple and enjoyed meeting people at the terrace bar downstairs which is right above the beach (a fun place to watch surfers). It was a mixed crowd, mostly gay men but not exclusively. The bartenders were friendly and attentive and the drinks were reasonable (especially during happy hour). There is a second terrace on the top floor of the building that we pretty much had to ourselves - super view! Would be nice to see it get renovated and used more. It has its own bathroom and shower as well as laundry facilities (washer, dryer, iron and ironing board - could use some attention). The area: Condado is close to everything - Old San Juan, the Plaza de Las Americas, etc. There are lots of restaurants within walking distance. We also walked to some gay bars in Santurce. You need to be street-smart to do that, but otherwise it's not a big deal, there are quite a few places to check out . I wasn't crazy about restaurants in PR in general, kind of pricey and not so special, but we had some OK tapas at Miro, and excellent lechon at Varita (better than what we tried in Guavate).

Reviews.Title: “location is the attraction for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jga_mcleod
Reviews.Content: The location is right on the beach and close to everything that you might need during your stay. It is a short bus ride to Old San Juan. They are in the middle of renovations and it does take away from my ability to rate what it will be once it is finished. They need to spend more time paying attention to details, especially the lobby area it needs to be spruced up more. The room was small but up to date and clean. If location is your main concern then for the money it is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Success”
Reviews.Author: vtnorth
Reviews.Content: When our taxi turned onto Vendig St. my wife and I crossed our fingures. Our first view was a narrow street with building construction going on and the 'O' was missing in Atlantic Beach Hotel. I had been in SJ while in the Navy back in the 60s and I really wanted a nice experience for my wife. And....that is how it turned out....very very nice. The rooms are small but newly done over and very clean. The beds are only double beds with matresses that could be more firm but we managed. The folks who work there are friendly with a capitol 'F' and very helpful. Being next to the ocean, a few steps from three casinos and a 75 cent bus ride from everything in the city; we could ask for nothing more. We plan to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Believe The Pictures On Their Website!”
Reviews.Author: aastevison
Reviews.Content: First the good- The hotel has a perfect location...directly on the beach and within minutes of old san juan, good eats, and popular nightlife. The hotels bar staff were top notch! Very friendly, adorable, and welcoming. Now the not so good- The hotel front desk staff. We got to the hotel after a very early flight, when we arrived the front door attendant was sleeping. Very secure feeling. The "management" staff was the rudest, most incompetent, bumbling set of fools I've ever come across. When I booked the room based off of the great price and the newly redone rooms (as the pictures would lead you to believe) i had no idea what truelly was in store for me. The room was tiny, by any standards. The tv was tiny and with no remote. (Not that a remote would have been usefull, you could touch both walls of the room with your hands extended.) The AC was not individually controlled and thus felt non existant. I attempted to approach the front desk manager and ask him to help me clarify the error that was made. I told him that i booked the room that came with two beds; his defense/responce was that i didnt book the "ocean view room". There was a distinct difference and I was clear in what I had booked. I called Orbitz and asked them to help me; the end result was the management told Orbitz if I wasnt happy with the accomidations that I could leave immediately. Thats customer service! They down right lied to Orbitz and told them I was in the upgraded room! What upgrade? The Hotels elevator was a throw back to colonial times; actually I think Chris Columbus must have used it. It felt like an electric casket...a smelly used one at that. Basice amenities- no toothpaste, shampoo, microwave, fridge, hair dryer...anything. Be thankfull you get a towel. The surrounding area (meaning right out the front door of the hotel) was apparently the neighborhood prostitute hangout. Puerto Rico, the people, the beach, the country side are all worth it, so at the end of it all does the hotel make that much of a difference? Heres what I've learned; you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: shredBoston
Reviews.Content: This is a well located, small hotel right on their little section of beach in the Condado resort area - 15 min walk from Old San Juan. Very small rooms with no chair or desk. Full size bed plus a single bed so the room was pretty crowded. Small Tv with cable. No internet connection. Clean efficient bathrooms - good maid service. nice desk attendants. Only public room is the outside, covered bar - no lobby to speak of and no food service at all. The place is a good deal for the price but there are NO extras in the hotel - you get your room, maid service and that's it. It's well located near many fine restaurants and will accommodate parking for your car if you're driving - for free.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't think it could get worse! Website is all lies! Avoid at all costs.”
Reviews.Author: BFNY1980
Reviews.Content: So this was the second time we stayed at the Atlantic Beach Hotel. Back in 2009 we stayed there. The rooms were dirty and moldy but the weather was awesome and so was the staff. We didn't want to stay there again this year until I checked the hotel website and saw that they had renovated. This was also confirmed by the man I spoke with on the phone. We were quite surprised when we arrived and absolutely nothing was different. The website is a total lie. The pictures they have posted are so far from reality its scary. The staff has changed too. I'm assuming there are new owners or something. Last year the staff was amazing. This year the woman behind the desk, I think the owner, was terrible. The worst kind of person. She acts like she's running a boarding school. Also the cleaning staff attempted to steal my friend's iPod and I'm pretty sure he took off with my watch. It has yet to be seen and I never lose things like that. Bottom line: Do not stay here. Do not trust the website. But do go have a drink with Armando the bartender. He's the ONLY good thing about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I should have heeded TripAdvisor... three-star price for a half-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: kkua
Reviews.Content: Because of the location (beachfront property), I wanted to give them the benefit of doubt. Boy was I was wrong. It all started with a lazy laissez-faire attitude of their staff and their web booking engine. Not only was it a non-secure site, it was not functional. The site is not Macintosh friendly, so I tried booking on Windows. I had to call them twice to remedy the problem before I could finally book for a simple overnight (Thursday around midnight going into Friday morning). Upon checking in, we thought we would have a nightcap at the patio bar before going upstairs. We then encountered a bunch of noisy gringos (20-something, brassy, sassy, loud, unrespectful, monolingual, obnoxious -- the stereotypical ugly American). After a quick gulp of the cocktail, we immediately left for the room (302). Avoid this room at all cost. The window was painted shut (and so was the subsequent relocated room) and the air vent was not functioning. They had the gall to ask me another US$100 for an upgrade to a bigger room, even when I'm only there for one night and the room was available. So, as a compromise, they moved us to 308. Got a loud awakening at 5am when the neighbors waddled into their rooms drunk (hallway and doors not noiseproof). The management mentioned there's an outside shower facility by the upstairs sundeck (sheltered). They allowed this for guest use, great particularly for late departing guests (flight at 8pm). Unfortunately, because of the storm, the shower curtain flailed everywhere, making it almost impossible to take a shower. No towels, soap or shampoo were provided (thank goodness I asked housekeeping earlier in the morning). Be sure you shower with some flip-flops... pebbles and sand everywhere. The patio area is also filled with broken glass. Only saving graces are free WiFi and the patio bar at the lobby. At US$105 per night plus an additional $40 in cabfare, I would almost prefer sleeping over at the YMCA or at a coushsurfing.com host. Video of stormy patio: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3jUtyNgArE0

Reviews.Title: “This place is disgusting and i didnt even went into the room”
Reviews.Author: franchescaPuertoRico
Reviews.Content: I made reservations with my husband so we could relax and have a weekend getaway. As soon as we enter the hotel i was disgusted. The floor was dirty like i hadn't been clean in months, the person that was in front desk was very rude. The pictures that they have in their website are very deceiving. Thank God that there was a problem with the reservation and we stayed someplace else. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone it look like a cheap motel.

Reviews.Title: “I'm not gay but this is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: whiltelotus
Reviews.Content: I have been traveled a lot and stayed many type of hotels from 500 rupee per night in India to 500 US dollars per night in Manhattan and Tokyo. It was the first trip to PR. I stayed the Atlantic Beach Hotel for four nights. The location is perfect and I could really relax with the sound of waves at their ocean view room and walking beach. It was reasonable rate even during the high season. Staff are friendly enough and they always welcome and respect any guests. Whenever I had requests them something(to adjust AC, extra amenity, recommend what to do, etc.), they responded soon. I will stay this hotel again when I have an opportunity to visit PR.

Reviews.Title: “love that place”
Reviews.Author: maryse718
Reviews.Content: My 5th time at the Atlantic beach hotel;love the location,the so nice staff and what a great surprise this year,big renovation;the rooms are freshly redone,new bathrooms,new furnitures,new linens and the beach have new furnitures as well,I didn't want to leave ;I will be back very soon especially for the low price they charge;

Reviews.Title: “I would consider other places...”
Reviews.Author: idontfindscreenname
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very convenient spot of El Condado. I completed the reservation by means of their website. The total amount was $258.33 (including taxes) for three nights which I found cheap for a hotel in this area. However, they charged me without notice a $50 deposit which was refunded after my check out. I stayed in room 304. This room was very small, does not has at least a microwave, the TV was very old. The cable company is okay. The beach is nice, but the weather was not favorable. There was high speed internet in the room as well in the bar downstairs. I think that I paid too much for the quality of service received in terms of room, facilities and overall customer service. When I chose this hotel I thought that it was like a motel, but it is more like a guest house. I am a Florida's resident. According to my experience in Florida, I am completely sure that for the same price I would receive a better quality of service in similar areas like Miami/Fort Lauderdale/West Palm Beach.

Reviews.Title: “great place ,clean, nice atmosphere ,friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: elieBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: great place on the water walking distant to a gym .friendly staff very helpfull in guiding for restaurant and tourist site

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is Practical, Efficient, Friendly, Affordable and with an Excellent Location.”
Reviews.Author: GringoNewHampshire
Reviews.Content: Ten minutes and $15 from the airport, this hotel is ideally located from anything one could possibly want in a Caribbean getaway. There is no need to rent a car as everything is nearby. This affordable, unpretentious little place is undergoing some renovations, so if a little dust in the hallway is a problem to you, then spend three times more next door at the huge Marriott. Right on a beautiful beach with lounge chairs and umbrellas, mix with other guests or locals in the hotel club, or at the daily beach party, or keep to yourself. Vendig is off Ashford street and has every type of store, restaurant, and American amenity from Walgreens and Starbucks to Cartier, Gucci, Ferragamo, and Louis Vuitton. Deco architecture and local art are everywhere, and Old San Juan is a few miles away. It's a safe walk if you want some exercise, and you will pass other beaches as well as find many health conscious Puerto Ricans jogging at all times of day and evening. If you're a family or want a walled, locked-in-fortresses with no connection to the local atmosphere, culture, or vernacular, then this is NOT the place for you. If you're a single or "young" open minded couple who like easy-going places with real flavor, interaction with the locals, and proximity to just about everything, then I would suggest the Atlantic Beach Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE FOR LESS , AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: miami305_305
Reviews.Content: I saw all the reviews and I did not wanted to pass throught that place. A few friends of mine called me and invited me to pass the day there, so I did. When I entered the lobby I expected something nasty but when I saw It was actually really nice. I spended time in the bar which has an expectacular view, and some pretty hot bartender's in the night time LOL. I decided to stay there because that's what I wanted, a place close to the beach and gay party's and clubs plus the staff it's so nice and helpful specially Manny and Armando. If you plan to stay somewhere close to everything, clean and nice I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Venue, Good Value, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Johninvegas
Reviews.Content: We were stayingin downtown San juan and accedently came3 across this quaint hotel with a bar overlooking the beach. It is modest in terms of the facility, but decent and clean. I'd recommend it to anyone who just wants to hang on the beach for a reasonable rate and friendly staff. Gay friendly, but not esclusively so.

Reviews.Title: “Dumpy, Run Down, Dirty - what a shame!”
Reviews.Author: lewisgm
Reviews.Content: This place is kinda like an aging starlet who has lost her looks but keeps trying to party with the A list. I kind of don't get it. This place is in a GREAT location and has so much potential that I don't understand why the owner does not fix it up. On the good side, it's right on Condada Beach. You can walk to the waves in 15 seconds. And the air conditioning kept the place nice and cool. Maybe even too cool. But on the downside, where can I start? The paint is chipping/peeling, the it does not look like it has been redecorated since the late 50's, the window in my room was dirty, the carpets looked like they were about 25 years old, the plumbing was weak and made noises like it was struggling, the bathrrom was musty and had mildew. The TV did not work. It was not a hell hole but it was kind of dumpy. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “it's basically all true”
Reviews.Author: CHALEA
Reviews.Content: i read all the reviews and thought how bad could this place be? nasty queens on the internet? fussy about everything?? im a seasoned traveler..high to low end depending on the city and my needs at the time.. but i have never scraped the bottom of the barrel until now!!.. really.. just about everything you read here is true..the hotels a dump..run down and rust everywhere.. tv didn"t work but fixed quickly.. hot water luke warm.. filthy floors ect..theair was fine on the second floor.. the staff however was awesome from the front desk to the bar.. so where did we go after paying $ 86.00 for this pit... 2 blks away to the holiday inn express wich is brand new..and average night 114,00 night.. fresh clean breakfast included.. and CENTRALLY LOCATED ALSO.. staff is awesome here.. and very very gay friendly.. down to the management!!.. questiions email me.. a ft. lauderdale traveler!!

Reviews.Title: “AVOID THIS PLACE LIKE THE PLAGUE!”
Reviews.Author: isail7c
Reviews.Content: This hotel is THE WORST hotel I have ever stayed at! I am a mariner and I have stayed at hotels all over the world on the company nickel so likewise, I don't see the greatest places when I travel for business but this place takes the cake! We stayed 6 days and had to change rooms 3 times due to malfunctioning AC equipment-they have some sort of funkadelic floor by floor system that was so choked up with lint that I could have written WASH ME on one of the walls in my room. The shower had black mold growing on the times, the towels-some provided where so thread bare that it looked like fishing net. The furniture has not been updated since the early 70's. This place needs to see the good side of a wrecking ball to put it out of it's misery. Either the hotel owner is waiting for a good offer from a property developer or there is something new in slumlord hotelier school! Really this place at 90 bucks a night is criminal in what they are trying to get away with. i will say that the people working there try and ave very polite and attentive-the beach bartenders in particular but if you have the choice and are on budget travel-try to spend a little extra somewhere else! The place is a mess and should have it's license revoked by the local hotel commission. I just read this flight attendent's review and am amazed at his take on the place-oh well-to each his own I guess!

Reviews.Title: “Hated it!”
Reviews.Author: robo17
Reviews.Content: The hotel was dirty and out of date. We could not get maid service for three days and called five times for fresh towels after two days. There are no services available and the hotel is run like an army barracks. The staff is not friendly and being billed as a gay hotel it was a major disappointment. Stay at the Holiday Inn for a reasonable price and skip this hotel completely.

Reviews.Title: “Run Down Hotel and Racist Staff”
Reviews.Author: jerseyboi2009
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is very unfriendly. Hustlers hanging out in front of the hotel. Rooms are dirty without any climate control so room is either too hot or too cold. Mattress had bed bugs. They used to serve breakfast in the morning but not anymore yet rates are the same. Not recommending this for anyone unless all you care about is staying in the gay hotel

Reviews.Title: “people make the place”
Reviews.Author: bigg1000
Reviews.Content: It's an older hotel on condado beach. The hotel is in need of repair but I agree with the last review,the people are the attraction that will bring me back. The service was great and the front desk clerk Jon Pierre was very helpful checking me in and a wealth of information on the area and night life. I don't know what I would have done without him. The bartender was helpful and the morning crew aswell. Over all I had a great time and the rooms are 79.00 per night, near some of San Juan's best night life,anyone who books a place for that price need to understand its not the Marriot. I will be returning in march of this year.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, outdated hotel”
Reviews.Author: burbujasdeamor
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect - right in the middle of Condado, right next to the beach. We had no problems with security like some of the other unfortunate souls. The staff and manager were super friendly and helpful, which was necessarily since the property is so outdated and many things were out of order: the elevator, key didn't work in our first room, TV sets half broken, leaky faucet/shower, etc. If it weren't for the location, I wouldn't pay $115 for the tiny room. Just go to the beach, use their beach loungers and buy drinks from their bar (friendly bartender will come to serve you).
